4wp4D8QYm9z8MPPqJGXHxg.text: Best mexican food in scottsdale. la fonda has been at this location for as long as i can remember and with good reason. The food is amazing and the staff is great. They are always so fun with my kids and remember us everytime we are there.

FDHRcyQlYeaAq69A_Z4M4Q.text: This place is nothing fancy but the food was pretty good, I got the shredded beef enchilada style but the enchilada sauce it a bit bland. However it is family friendly for those with small kids.

vrS0g4NRT_IdPCpKHp0qEg.text: Ate here with a friend that told me they had great salsa. She was right, however I don't get the salsa in a jar thing. My margarita was good too. My taco and enchilada combo was OK, but nothing great. I had asked for a side of sour cream, which I later found out on my bill cost me $2.00 for a tablespoon of sour cream! The server should have told me that, and I would have declined because that's insane - I deducted it from her tip, not to mention she seemed to want nothing to do with us.  The place is old and run down. The ceiling fan light that was over us was flickering and clearly needed to be changed. I think I almost had a seizure from all the flickering.   I haven't been back since, not saying that I wouldn't try it again, but was not impressed enough to want to come back.

DnqYzWCyW3_jtZurP8R8YA.text: I have been eating here since high school (almost 20 years). Yikes. Such good food. A local AZ Mexican food staple.

UAXtlxcYtT57Y-xREtn_AQ.text: The food was great (I had the mini platter or something close to that) and it was fantastic.  There was a lot of food so I didn't finish, but definitely delicious.  The staff was good...my only issue was with how loud it was.  There were several kids in the back room, which is only separated by a curtain, so it was so loud I actually couldn't hear my date talking much of the time.  Overall...good place to go!

1NH_MFxLHVEg1j09uoa2Aw.text: Ordered two entrees via Uber eats. They did not include tortillas with the fajitas, a pretty big part of fajitas. When we called to inquire, they said the tortillas were there and they forgot to include them. They basically had no solution and when we suggested they refund the price of the fajitas they laughed and told us to get lost. Go to Ajo Al's instead. Very rude.

y5yH2iR2nY1sX-Ih2mi1FQ.text: Great food and awesome service! I order through Grubhub but the driver decided not to do his job. The restaurant manager was very sympathetic and ensured that muy dinner to be delivered by one of his employees. My food was delicious and the quality of the service made it even better. Thank you! I will definitely come for more and I will dine in

eVF4ko9PkadqowphF3ZO-g.text: I LOVE their food! The queso dip is amazing as are the chimichangas and green corn tamales. I look forward to going there.

aSArFuRj9-NzOPeEgXrr7Q.text: This place is located near where a friend of mine worked and we started going at least once month for lunch.  We've continued that same pace for well over a decade.  Therefore, I've probably had more meals here than any other restaurant in the Phoenix area, besides it's close to where I live.  We like there food, service and atmosphere; although it is more of a dive than an upscale place, but I like it.  Lunch times can get very busy but the food arrives fast, the staff is friendly and the food consistently good.  This is just your regular Phoenix Mexican food, but good.  Whenever we go to another Mexican restaurant we always end up saying "it's not as good as La Fonda Del Sol" (with only one exception, but one in a completely different category - Los Reyes de la Torta).  As soon as you sit down they bring some of their wonderful homemade tortilla chips and two different homemade salsas; one hot (as in spicy) and one chunkier and not so hot.  Although I know I'm always going to "suffer" if I eat too much of their hot salsa, I simply can't resist and always ask for more chips and hot salsa; and then my intestines aren't happy with me because of all the "hot."  I'd say that over 95% of our visits have been for lunch, so we always order from their lunch specials.  They do offer a wonderful, all you can eat; lunch buffet which I've tried and is very good, but since I don't eat large portions it is sort of lost on me.  Besides I simply love their lunch "Cheese Relleno."  My friend almost always orders their lunch "Taco Salad."  They have very good margaritas which we occasionally have.    Recently I've had several friends in from out-of-town that wanted Mexican food, so I've always spouted off several places we could go, but always include this "little Mexican dive."  Every one of them has always selected this place claiming that the dives have the best food.  I tell them there are more upscale places we could go to but there response is "we're buying and we don't want to spend much money on you (ha)."  They've all loved it.  We are regulars in there.  Absolutely a 5-star "dive" wonderful Mexican restaurant.  Please, please, please - La Fonda Del Sol, never go out of business.

QXDoZgSBPOef-2NyMiDvYA.text: Best Mexican food in Scottsdale. Fresh chips and homemade salsa. Fajitas were wonderful period been coming here for years and always have consistency in the food service and atmosphere. Great price for quality food.

XM5ocJa5uyv-8VJVv47UHg.text: Not much on atmosphere, but don't worry about that.  Some of the best Mexican food that I have ever had.  Portions are plentiful and the service was great.  You MUST go here!!!!!  I have the Chicken Fajita, my wife had a guacamole tostada and a chicken tamale, and our friend had a shrimp tostada.  Everyone was raving!!!!!!

KY9K1R5fqptfp1BXEIJV6A.text: I've been coming to La Fonda del sol since 1992. When I lived in the Valley a meal there was a minimum once a week.  Since moving away from the area I still come to visit annually and make my first meal at La Fonda. Have had a variety of dishes but nothing beats their enchiladas; red or green, shredded beef tacos and their special chimi with chicken or beef. Their chips are light and crispy and always  served hot and fresh. Their mild salsa rivals no other! A stop here for an authentic meal which will not disappoint... Hasn't me for almost 25 years!

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Green chile cheese enchilada and shredded beef taco=one divine meal! This place never disappoints!
Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. La Fonda&#39;s mild salsa. Fresh and flavorful beyond compare!

slzYjES1giK8_O0YzPG4iw.text: Food is good, not great but what shocked me the most are their prices.  Almost double anyone else of similar or better quality in town.  Habanero's, across the street is much lower priced and better food.

Ke9hNNMugcZxFgLXYpUtUQ.text: This is by far the best Mexican spot in all of Arizona. I was in town visiting from California and my mind was blown. All of the food is freshly cooked! The cheese crisp is to die and everything else on the menu is absolutely amazing. I went here 3 days in a row just to be able to try as many items off of the menu as possible. For those looking for some fantastic margaritas this is your place. A muGreat for families also!

6aE2zOuyiW7XxTlhn1Phsw.text: Outstanding food, great prices, great atmosphere! It came up as the #1 Mexican restaurant in Scottsdale and it did not disappoint.

rwQ3LvmrR7Up0CuSI4DB3A.text: Meh, very mediocre. Ordered a shrimp taco. Pieces of griiled shrimp ( fortunately was tasty) and a flour tortilla with a small mound of shaved lettuce. Need I say more. The chips are processed ones.

RfQTkLNCBAGtY3yJo-Is7Q.text: This place is great! The service is is top notch, always attentive. World's best fajitas, and huge portions. They never let your drinks or chips go empty. This is definitely one of my favorite Mexican restaurants, and I will continue to come to.

5xrCnYHv9YjkoqZVvK6OCQ.text: I was in the area and decided to try this place with my family. The food was canned and barely warm. The tortillas are store bought and the salsa is not homemade. Plus, the service was slowly and blah. And the manager lady had her family come through and they got served with drinks and food on the spot. My family, paying customers had to wait 45 minutes for a kids meal, taco salad and burrito.

5nJldpNtnN4sJUTOEAn1Sg.text: I will admit that this review is a little bias because 1. I grew eating the food and 2. I worked here. Oh and 3. I know the crew who are fantastic. The food here is my favorite Mexican food spot in Scottsdale. What makes it a great experience is the friendliness and cleanliness of the staff and restaurant.

G2K9KwxuM3q99-0G82r3Cg.text: Night before we went to The Mission. Supposedly the groovy food for Mex. too weird for me After drinks at Maestros we needed food! La Fonda is the bomb!  Roach atmosphere but awesome chow! Green Chili Burrito and Chicken Enchiladas  Cadillac Margarita  and Negro Modelo Sleeping well tonight

Jnkfr2tiqucOgdj9KIBbMQ.text: Went on a busy Saturday night and was able to get a table with no wait. Service was good and fast. Salsa and chips were fresh and tasty. Went with the servers recommendation and got the Toppopo Salad. Chicken was seasoned well and the salad dressing was light and very good.

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Toppopo Salad

HMH1wgiGAFIWsK4-ObluXw.text: Great nachos and everything is made fresh to order. highly recommend the Cadillac margarita on the rocks

hJdkr8Y9d9tQxXxZvMvzVA.text: I went here last night with 2 girlfriends for a celebratory occasion. We were seated in a booth and promptly served warm tortilla chips (homemade) with 2 little carafes of salsa (one was pico de gallo and the other was a spicier).  I ordered the 2 Tamale dinner and was a tad disappointed as there was so much melted cheese and grease, I couldn't even "find" the 2 alleged tamales?! I did sample my friend's dinner (2 beef tacos) and the beef was perfectly seasoned and not too dry - great job!!   The service was friendly and attentive - I may go back here but definitely would order something else. I came home smelling of Mexican restaurant, and the smell was still lingering in my car the following morning driving to work?

9rlMAHa0pMdjOZt8txAz2A.text: What else is there to say but that LaFonda is the best in Mexican food! Each time we visit the Phoenix area LaFonda Del Sol is a must stop location. The service is friendly and punctual and you cannot go wrong regardless of the meal. If you're a snooty type, the ambiance may not be your speed. In the end, the line out the door waiting for a table tells the story.

lvuOFCAKDQXjRATA_F0k_A.text: Service was horrible for my takeout order. The only person to help was the hostess and she was the only to even say a word to me. But the food was great!

19R_2n_c8VRppJdCUK679A.text: after seeing another person's post, I made sure to take notice if the fat little fish that greeted us when we walked in.  the beef chimichanga was delicious.  chips and salsa were good though the mild salsa was too hot for my partner to taste.

iRhQj4ysA353cBNovZjeiA.text: What a treat! Visiting from Chicago and heard about this gem from a local. Between our group we ordered the Carne Asada dinner, the 'Armando's' dinner and a ala cart mixture of shrimp taco, carne asada taco, chicken enchilada and a green tamale. I'm honestly still having a hard time ranking my favorite, they were all so exceptional. As if the food wasn't enough to get me back in the door, the service was even better! Bridget was our server and she was amazing. Two thumbs up. Five stars. Not a bad thing to say.

q_iKYaOazFE9jqm1lRsRlw.text: I've always loved La Fonda's! They used to have one in Tempe years ago that I would go to as a kid.The Albondiga soup is awesome! Go here and enjoy some authentic Mexican food!

rpr2Bs4vsZGDt_f8_nWfTQ.text: Have to say how thoroughly impressed we all were with La Fonda!! And, when I say "we" I mean our party of 35 people ...teenagers and parents after a soccer league tournament with most guests here from other states. First off, they gladly took our reservation and our nice long table was set and easy to go when we arrived. Second, as the group filtered in they were quick to take our drink orders (BTW margaritas are perfectly mixed), and third, the owner, Roman, managed to effortlessly take everyone's order with having to keep track of managing about 10 different checks!!! The food (which was amazing!!!) came out fast, hot, and perfect!! With all the noise and chaos amidst our own group, there were 2 orders miscommunicated, but, they fixed everything quickly and were all too glad to make everything perfect. We had so many different items ordered, but everyone had nothing but smiles, compliments and empty plates at the end (even with the huge portions)...it was just that hard to stop eating. I personally had the spinach enchiladas and they were divine! Fresh chips, home made salsas and sauces, warm and gracious staff all added to an unforgettable group dinner! We will definitely be back!!!

gYbhvRf_oJlRyr6Ak1ZWIg.text: Passed by so many times and never tried it til just recently when the Mexican Craving kicked in!   Very tasty huge portions, can definitely share an entree with two people. I thought the refried beans were a little too salty. The service was slightly slow but that may be due to the fact that this place was busy. Our waitress, Claudia was very nice and funny. The busser refilled our chips without asking, that was nice.   Overall it's a great little place and we will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Guac, chicken enchiladas and the Special La Fonda Chimichanga!

KUf8uFPryfF-MvnfEl1VMw.text: So good. Cheap, delicious, authentic, no frills. Very kind staff. Nice outdoor covered patio in the back. Best nachos of my life.

MZ40pKidEqfYI2uLGLoQcQ.text: My wife and I decided to check out this local Mexican spot and we were overall pleased. The good: 1) the food was good and came out fast 2) the service was attentive 3) the margaritas were good and on happy hour... the bad: 1) the margaritas were small. That just means I had to order more :) we will definitely be back to this old and rustic Mexican eatery.

O2Py9_SbU-pN4eGJy9ErLA.text: Food was very average, nothing to write home about. The first thing we noticed was how loud it was. The way the restaurant is set up makes it very loud if there are a lot of people there.  We went on a Friday night so it was busy. It was hard to have conversation with the person sitting across from me.

VrywnWr8smdD42fD8JW3UQ.text: This was not enjoyable. The service was good and our server was attentive. We were not impressed with the food. The salsa had so much onion and cilantro that we could not taste the tomatoes. It was overwhelming with onion favor. The queso was very similar to nacho cheese dip from a can, it was not the traditional white Mexican cheese, it was bright yellow. My tacos were cold.

DCCCh_UdGjhBzap2kqYhGg.text: After eating here several times - finally, a review.  This place is good!  What do I like about La Fonda Del Sol, you ask?  Well, first, it definitely has an ol' family restaurant, cantina-dive vibe.  Second - chips are brought to the table with two carafes of salsa and the chips are always HOT.  I mean HOT.  And Fresh - if not needing just a little salt.  Salsas are both delicious, and fresh.  (One of my favorite new "F" words.). Queso is delicious, and tip/note - comes with freshly made flour tortilla chips, not corn as is served HOT and complimentary with salsa.  Obviously a crowd pleaser because every table around me ordered the queso.  Third - Food comes out quickly, and also HOT.  Can't touch the plate hot.  And how do they make it stay hot for so long?  I have ordered a number of dishes but still come back to the chicken chimi with cream cheese.  I love cream cheese, and it is a different and tasty addition.  Seriously, I think there are three shredded/chunked chicken breasts wrapped in a deep fried pillow of delicious, then smothered with green sauce and melted cheese.  I have noticed they don't call it green chili on the menu, and it really isn't traditional green chili.  It is delicious though, and obviously made fresh from fire roasted green chilis.  Not too pepper hot - just the right "kick."  Tasty retried beans; and rice.  Some may complain about the price, but for me each dish is at least two meals - so worth it from my perspective.    What to watch out for?  It gets crowded, and L-O-U-D.  Service is typically good, but I am not sure how they "assign" tables.  We typically have to wait to be first greeted, but then it stays pretty consistently attentive.  I have never been in the bathrooms, so can't speak to them, but the place is clean-ish.  Not dirty; just not confidently clean.  There were a couple of used napkins on the floor under my table, and I had to brush crumbs off my chair.  Not a big deal though.  The entry is not inviting.  In fact, it's a bit scuzzy.    Lastly, my only and completely random complaint, that they can really do nothing about (and it isn't deterring me from going back) - when you leave, you and your clothes are going to smell like you've been immersed in onion-grease-Mexican-corn-salsa-dip.  Not sure why or what it is because it isn't a prevalent smell or Odor inside - but trust me, you're going to smell it until the clothes and hair are washed.  All in all a good spot for tasty Mexican food!

rnEzIRWDqkAMKXrG4Gzzcw.text: First time there and they have a cute little enclosed front porch which is great at all times of the year (except summer of course). It's kinda a divey little spot but divey for your grandma. Prices are right in line with every other mexican spot. The normal fare, chimis, burritoes, fajitas, tacos. I had the cheese enchiladas and they were amazing! La Fonda offers something a little different in a mexican food place in that they have an all you can eat buffet, lots of different types of meat and beans. Pretty cool, no valid complaints other than the service was kinda slow but they were still friendly. Check it out, you won't be disappointed.

5niI3TBv7L4Jr2bD1aTOXQ.text: Neighborhood Mexican restaurant been there forever the manager knows every customer by name. I give it 3 stars because it's nothing special but 5 stars for a place to go get a good Mexican meal. My bill was a little high for what I had and later I found that I was over charged just a mistake that I hope they will correct. No one was out to cheat me of 15 bucks. This place was packed and is always packed from what I hear

FhMd-whfwAz5JlF9PQc_Bg.text: Delicious! The food was surpassed only by our waitress Claudia! She was everything that a restaurant wants in heir help -- knowledgeable, friendly and so stinking funny! I had the beef & chicken flautas, my daughter had the #20 carne Assada & my husband had the burrito and taco platter. We left with empty plates and full bellies! We'll be back soon for sure.

_qZQ_nN6Fg5aMkCcUOinOA.text: just ok food I got the Burro is was stewed pork in gravy placed inside a cold flour not home made tortilla.  the chips and salsa were ok the salsa was not hot.  I drank my first beer no one asked me if i needed another.  I was dinning alone I guess I wasnt worth the trouble I felt like I was sort of an afterthought.

ytSkbL2TfqGbrU3k6Y11pQ.text: Probably one of my favorite spots I've been to so far in scottsdale. Very good authentic food. Staff was great. The chips and salsa are fantastic and the food is soooo good.

rsCcrTnBv4mvmRIeceZevg.text: This place has been around forever, and while I don't ever remember eating here before, my dad assured me that I had. The place is no frills on the outside, but has a quaint charm to it on the inside.  The chips and salsa were really good, the salsa was very fresh.  We got a cheese crisp to start, and it was definitely a good version.  Before we could even finish it our food started coming out of the kitchen.  My sister and I both ordered Combo #10 which included a shredded beef taco and a red or green cheese enchilada, we both chose red. Like a typical Mexican restaurant, our plates came out piping hot with the standard "Don't touch, the plate is very hot" warning from our waiter.  First things first, I took a forkful of beans and held it up, I could see the steam rising from them, I took the bite and was immediately in heaven! These are the beans that I have been searching for!!! They were so creamy and delicious, and had just enough cheddar cheese sprinkled on top....I could have seriously just had a plate of the beans and been happy!  I took a bite of the enchilada, I really liked the enchilada sauce, it had wonderful flavor and there was not too much cheese to where that was all you could taste, it was an excellent enchilada. I then tried the taco; the shell was crisp and filled with the shredded meat, lettuce, cheese and tomatoes. It was really good, the meat was not the best shredded beef I have ever had, but all the components together made it a taco that I would order again.  My dad loved the chile relleno con carne, he said it was a good version, and one of the best that he had had recently.  I decided I definitely needed to add La Fonda into my rotation, if only for the beans alone!

bI9PCI1kGoDep7QEabjmFQ.text: "Yummy, & big-plate Mexican food in Scottsdale!" 4/5  La Fonda has been one of our favorite restaurants for the last 2 years. We love going there to get some house margaritas with one or two plates of soul, comfort Mexican food. My favorite is its Shrimp Fajitas hot plate. J always like their Combo dish. Remember to pour some spicy salsa sauce on your food if you like hot stuff! :) We love the place and would recommend all our friends to try it out!

h97XAIgPKIaoyBM7G0Zltg.text: Yum Yum! Great chips and salsa, phenomenal service. Soda is always nasty, no matter what I order. The food is great! Their green corn tamale takes the cake as best tamale, and with chicken over it it is delightful. Tostadas, taco salads, taquitoes, just about everything here has been delicious. Great enchiladas, etc. They have amazing refried beans, really some of the best. Very friendly atmosphere. We go here all the time. While their cheese crisps are by no means crispy, the cheese they use is amazing, and I often crave it. I have it with their salsa and its awesome. Even though Im normally fond of crispy cheese crisps, this is addictive! Love La Fonda Del Sol cant wait to return!

9wttW83E5hI3aeIg9dgymg.text: This is my favorite kind of Mexican place: divey with character (if that's not a redundant term). To have a place like this in Scottsdale is a rarity.   Ditto to the previous reviews about excellent food and excellent salsa. The salsa is especially impressive, being the chunky flavor-packed kind that I love. Our entrees were both less than 8 bucks a pop.

kBrA34S3fYiceDT8FO8Qog.text: May be I went on a bad day for the kitchen, but the dishes I had was well below the average touristy level.  - the salsa that came with the chips tasted generic and canned - the menudo was a quarter chunk of a potato, half of a carrot cut in two and some blobs of flavorless beef - the mexican pizza was soggy and chewy (no, not in a good way) - the green corn tamale covered in chilli sauce is the only thing that made me think the kitchen can be better  La Fonda Del Sol is a place that I pass by a lot.  But it looks like I'll have to keep on passing on by.

0dS59pRX0fKBwwI5LemFWw.text: If you want grease, come here.  If you want to feel like there is a giant ball of lard sitting at the bottom of your stomach, come here.  If you want diarrhea for the next 24 hours due to stomach lubrication, come here.  I went to La Fonda's because of the name. La Fonda reminded me of  the chick in Neapolitan Dynamite.  We set down and you can tell this place is family owned. There we're young teenagers waiting on the table, and their english wasn't even that great. After I received my enchiladas/beans/rice plate, I looked down to see a HUGE pile of grease.  Beans are what you'd expect from a can you buy at the store. No real flavor, nothing special. The rice was on the plain side too. Pretty authentic, but lacked flavor. Good sauce on the enchilada, but boy that pool of grease made me quiver.  Hot hot chips, decent salsa.  What can I say? I won't be back again. I like my Mexican food more fresh, but that's just me.

bmxG3BmsJyq08lsiRA8WAQ.text: Great food and great staff. My daughter loved the buffet. Lunch was huge and great value. Can't imagine what dinner is like. Sit in Bridgette's section

ulCFLKcpUeGHElACe7cHmQ.text: Great food, great salsa and surprisingly good coffee at a very reasonable price (make that a low price if you are going for lunch between 11am-4pm).  La Fonda Del Sol is by no means elegant, but that doesn't seem to be the point of this place, i.e. it doesn't need to be.  It's definitely worth checking out if you're in the mood for good non-corporate chain Mexican food.  P.S. Although I've not yet had a chance to try the margaritas (and I hate to post hearsay) they come highly recommended from what I would call a "trusted source." I'll update when I have personal knowledge.

y1rE38sQriXJbhTmFz8oog.text: We love this place and have been going there for twenty years. The food is authentic and reasonably priced. It has a family atmosphere. The chimichangas are incredible. La Fonda is a fantastic neighborhood Mexican restaurant. Great food and easy to get in and out of quickly.

XBywCtTZKD1HKT9-jhWkqg.text: Refried beans are awesome - best in the Valley!  Their hot sauce is terrific, but my husband wasn't a huge fan of the regular salsa.  The front entrance could definitely use some brightening up a bit, but don't let that deter you!  Give this place a shot!

fIt7y8Qz54aav62ethgzcw.text: Came here because Oregano's was packed on a Saturday night.  I wonder how many of their customers are in the same boat.  I was initially craving Mexican food anyway, so I didn't care.    The service is awesome, the beer was so cold it was almost icy (read: awesome) and the salsa is yummy yummy.  I ordered the specialty chimichanga and my mom got rolled tacos.  The plates were hu-hu-hu-huge.  And can I just say that cream cheese makes everything better, especially chimichangas.  YUM.    Not the best Mexican joint I have ever been to, but definitely decent enough to visit again (for the locals).

DJVqycL0TJ3NFRim3A52Xw.text: I never write bad reviews because I feel I have better things to do with my time but this place was worth writing about.  Walked in and stood up front for 5 minutes before anyone even acknowledged us.  And when they did some lady said they didn't have room right now to  wait.  When we waited another 10 minutes I went up to her and asked if we could be seated and she simply said no and walked away!!   I told her and another waitress standing next to her that they were very rude and we wanted to go somewhere else they said okay bye.  Don't waste your time or money!

glW1p20IfW8ssod38tuxxA.text: This place is exactly what I like in a Mexican restaurant.  The menu has everything you would expect to find, executed well, in an unpretentious atmosphere.  It's also missing everything I don't want in a Mexican restaurant, namely a giant corporation/theme park vibe with sterilized Mexican dishes to suit bland American palates.

8cF8DJ4VjesTOwZW3jH_7Q.text: Great chips & salsa.  Great, inexpensive Mexican food.  If you've got the craving, the place will take care of it.  And don't miss the margaritas.

oY3LgRJL5IGhfRySzdk48w.text: I really like this place. Good food with pretty good prices. Salsa is great. I've eaten here a few times so I've tried a few things but my fav is the chimichanga. Yummy. The servers are friendly.

GBNu5bGlyb3dinEsIDmJeQ.text: The best Mexican food in AZ friendly staff and great prices! I have tried new items every time I have come in and have always enjoyed each one. My favorite is the carne asada.

GEM_noISJ2WhIkjgrO9mtA.text: Very good authentic Mexican food. I tend to judge authenticity and goodness of Mexican food by a) how much beans, rice, and cheese do they pile on, and b) if I ate nothing but beans and rice, would it be delicious? The answers here are a) plenty and b) yes! I bought a sampler with an enchilada and a taco. The taco was one of those homestyle kind, where they start with a soft tortilla and fry it into shape until it's crispy. The setting is only so-so, it's a narrow dining room with not a lot of variety of seating options. The price was quite reasonable, but not cheap, somewhere around less than $15 after drink and tip for the least expensive but filling sampler lunch on the menu.

dOdyx7AOefvkmCm1tEbRkQ.text: I ended up at this restaurant because of a recent livingsocial.com deal. It turned out to be a great buy and allowed me to find some "authentic" mexican food in Phoenix. I was really pleased with this restaurant, and will definitely return. For starters, the chips and salsa were excellent. And you can have as much as you want, without being charged for an extra basket of chips. I ordered a combo plate with tamale, taco, and cheese enchilada. It also came with rice and beans. Everything was great. The enchilada was my favorite part of the dish, and I will definitely stick with this next time. The tamale was very good for a restaurant tamale, and would hold up with any home made tamale out there. The taco was not the best. the meat was a little overcooked do to the deep frying of the shell, but it was still good. Just not my personal favorite. The enchilada was very good. You could taste the home made tortillas and the red sauce was very tasty. Definitely recommend. The rice was very good and authentic. The beans were ok, but not the best I have ever had. All in all, this is the best mexican food I have had so far in Phoenix. It only gets 4 stars though, because I have had much better in other cities. But so far, I have not found better in Phoenix. This will definitely be a frequently visited spot to satisfy my craving for authentic mexican food.

qqRysr_JZh9K6grMhytPqQ.text: This place has been in Scottsdale forever. I ate there a few years ago then sort of lost track of it. Returned for dinner the other night and wished I had been eating there all along. Great fish tacos. Would recommend this place. Good food good prices great service.

NzvlCBJXilw0muplAOTGxw.text: Well, after being a long-time customer who ate here regularly, I find that in the past 6-12 months, the food has gone downhill. It seems the cook is getting lazy and the food is simply below average most times. I am very disappointed and we have started going over to Habanero's instead. Sad to see a family restaurant go downhill, but that happens after time and as the owners get older.

SToPC_lgq4HxYvZS57Jhkw.text: Love the simplicity of this restaurant , fresh good food and great service! Never been dissapointed.

5TTFZJPS83pcPPcN6c6DuQ.text: Fajitas with burnt vegetables and a chx quesadilla with 8# of cheese, zero vegetables. I'll pass.

4so11gmY0YKawutGVGValg.text: This place is a nice little Mexican restaurant. I had a carne asada taco and a chicken enchilada. The carne asada was amazing! The enchilada was decent. I will definitely recommend this place to friends.

KIqOWK6gJ0PaISklqnjelA.text: Super food.  Always crowded, but the staff get you seated and fed.  Order the pitcher of beer to save a bundle.

zi3uX3AGaPN2prhV8ZbiYg.text: Never been here. Just tried to get a menu to place an order for an office.  I was told there is no menu on the web.  And that they can't fax me one.  So.... they don't want take out business??  He said I should come in. Then what - call back to the office for the orders of everyone.

HUA9bqd5hV6KaqJMktwLkw.text: Had the buffet...absolutely terrible.  Not sure where the get the beef from but really tough

0NEwt9DPcfA1Kzus430f5A.text: Like many people, we ended up at La Fonda thanks to an hour+ wait at Oreganos. It's nothing fancy and I wouldn't recommend this place for a date night or a night to impress anyone by ambiance, but I have to admit that the food was fantastic. And if there's one thing my family knows about - it's Mexican Food.   I had a simple Bean & Cheese Burrito enchilada style and it was delicious. It was moist and filled with tons of beans and cheese and the enchilada sauce was great. My mother-in-law go the salad with fresh grilled pineapple, mango and chicken and it was delicious as well. The chips and salsa were pretty good (I still prefer Aunt Chiladas) but the service was quick, the vibe was mellow and the food was tasty.   I don't live in the area and won't be driving out of my way to come back, but I'd recommend it if you're in the area and looking for some good Mexican.  Note: the combination entrees seemed a little pricey to me. We each got al-a-cart items which came with sour cream, lettuce & tomato and were plenty big.

ug-FqcVhpiU08WNXQ00kVw.text: After reading reviews on Yelp we decided to try this place. The iced tea was terrible, light brown and had a weird after taste. The salsa & chips were disappointing, all I could taste on the mild salsa was thei onion but my husband said the hot salsa was better. We had a quesadilla which was okay. My son had a bean burrito with rice, he loved the burrito but generally isn't a fan of Spanish rice. My husband has the chile rellano and was disappointed. I had the Machaca Chimi & beans. Both my husband & my plate were beyond hot! The refried beans were actually bubbling! I am not exaggerating when I tell you we had to wait about 20 minutes to eat our food because it was so hot! In all fairness the chimi & beans were actually good but overall not a pleasant experience.The service was okay but not great. Sad to say we were sorely disappointed!

lmnTK9yrAoymExohQauspA.text: This place is as good as it gets. Wonderful food, great friendly staff and just a nice atmosphere for a mexican restaurant. I return here every time I am in Scottsdale and I am always greeted with a friendly hello from the owner herself. I am not sure there is another mexican restaurant in the Phoenix / Scottsdale area that I would go to if in the mood for a good margarita and some mexican food.

y7_chBbO2sxJtAB4RFz2ew.text: Looks dicey on the outside but the food is good and authentic.  Coming from an east coast guy.

9v6UUFqbpKotCLkYqa-MBA.text: I've been coming here for years. The staff treats everyone like family and I wouldn't go anywhere else in scottsdale for Mexican food. absolutely love it

eOpQ2AsgJMzmW43n3zHgeg.text: Pretty descent buffet. Good quality food. Chicken fajitas were bomb :) so were  the cheese enchiladas

DR27KKFjgEO4zqTutkpHQg.text: Pretty good place.  My wife and I were happy to see they were open New Years Day for dinner.  We had flown in earlier in the day.  We were seated right away and got our drinks fast.  The place was busy but we were not ignored.  We got a sampler ala cart plate because we were ready to try some authentic Mexican food rather than Northwest Mexican food.  We had a tamale and chili relleno.  Both were good.  Good flavor and cheesey but not too much.  Of course the tamale doesn't compare to Bobby Flay's tamale at his restaurant but this was a good one.   I think next time we will have to get a margharita and try some other items.

Dh7DIbjW1hYhcbkVGG6f8Q.text: Love this place. All melted together. Margaritas so good. Salsa the best.  Love John!

14NwVS_EQIBJheIY7hjuHA.text: You would think this place is actually in Mexico given how long I had been meaning to try it.  I can only say, I should have gone sooner.  Really good Mexican food-not the touristy crap or the Scottsdaled up version.  I tried the green chile and loved it.   Decor is nothing to write home about, but not a complete dive either.  Service was excellent.  I actually didn't find it all that cheap considering it's basic Mexican food, but I guess it's cheap for Scottsdale.  Dinners run about $12 on average.  Lunch about $7.  They also have breakfast.  On the bad side, they apparently have a lunch buffet.  God only knows how big my ass will get knowing that tidbit of information.  Five dollar a gallon gas may actually be a good thing.

WkQ31Uab6DlMt7C0J_1tgA.text: This is one of the oldest still-running restaurants in the area. It shares a name with one of the newest restaurants on Park Avenue in New York, but is completely unrelated. In fact, I'm sure the experience you'll have here is just about the opposite.  It's in a location that the 70s Historical Preservation Society must be fighting to keep alive. I'd like to say it has character, but this old poorly designed strip should probably be nuked from space. However, you can't really complain too much when it's one of the few remaining old-school Mexican joints in town.   It's clean, everyone is nice, and the atmosphere inside is cozy. As my mother said... if you eat here, you can pretty much plan on going home smelling like Mexican food. Whether that's a good or bad thing can be up to you.   The food is just slightly above average for this type of place. Chips were okay. I put the salsa as below average. It was flavorless, but hot. The cheese crisp was good... not too oily. The guac was good. My entree was decent. It's the type of place that serves you standard old-school dishes - generally an ugly 70s plate full of grease with a sea of beans and slop and cheese and whatnot on the side. Same story as many other places. Too much to eat, and basically none of it is healthy, and basically all of it will either constipate you or clean you out.  The margaritas were pretty good. I would eat and drink here again I suppose if someone else was paying. This is your mom and dad's joint. Wish it was better.

FHTSVsMtZG_vTZ1N19oXyA.text: Just discovered this neighborhood treasure.  This family owned and operated business prides itself on knowing its clientle and every time my husband and I visit, they remember our usual drink order -- and have remembered almost from the first visit -- and have it ready for us the moment we sit down.  My favorite dish is the tamales, which are something I learned to love in my home state of Texas, and I love, love, love La Fonda Del Sol's version of home style tamales.    The food is reasonably priced, generous portioned; the wait staff is friendly, and service is prompt.   I judge a Mexican place by the quality of its salsa, and this place wins big on the salsa.  One is mild, but really flavorful, and the other has a great level of heat.  The chips are great.  In all the ways a Mexican restaurant should be good, this one is great.

ggTzHvZRzgsnz7wfgGFx_A.text: Love the food and the atmosphere. The staff is so nice.  Love their pollo fundido.  Gotta love a good locally owned, small pace! Love it, I bring company to this restaurant whenever they're in town!

JRgx_XPRFk8lW8HykTbbwA.text: Exellant food! Inexpensive lunch buffet ( like 8.95). Friendly staff. Best beans and rice anywhere! Not much more to ask for. Food portions are inconsistant, I think it depends on who's cooking.

gUj0yyfvkbcBjZHpfHPOIw.text: I have been going to La Fonda Del Sol ever since I was a kid! It is one of those tiny gems you only find if you stumble upon it. In my opinion, the best Mexican food is from the tiny, non-corporate style restaurants and this place does NOT disappoint! It is delicious and it is a GREAT value. So it's a WIN WIN. The building though, could definitely use a face-lift. But other than that, give it a go!

fOaPj_ISFqi7ejDi7YZcsQ.text: Service so slow that I had to get up with my empty bowl and find our waitress for more chips. In my 50 yrs on this planet I've never left an unfinished margarita until now...It was more like pink ice with a plasticy aftertaste....

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

T8EIOpkVSKIiS0rvSVdKvg.text: First off we got our food for takeout, when we got home, we had realized they had forgotten some of the food. The food that they did get was way too salty to the point where the steak tasted like it had been left overnight in soy sauce. Also the food was super oily and very unenjoyable. Would not recommend.

bfnU5M4bL1uqTLC_wiDfnA.text: Well, it's not bad, but it's pretty darned pedestrian. The rice was flavorless, beans taste like they came out of a can. The much anticipated carnitas tamale was smothered in a run of the mill red enchilada sauce that totally masked any flavor it may have had.   I found it also be a little pricey for what it is. Not outrageous by any means, but barely one step up from Taco Bell, shouldn't cost three steps up.  On the plus side, the guacamole was excellent. garnishes of cheese and black olive slices were a very nice touch, and a perfect contrast against the tangy guac. The chips were great, very thin, crispy, and served scorching hot. I also like the chunky fresh tasting salsa. (There is a second mini carafe of a hotter version which you can blend to your desired level of heat). Overall though, our entrees reminded me more of the frozen mexican "tv dinners" that my Mom would heat up for us in the oven than anything I'd expect to be served in a restaurant. Satisfying, but lowest common denominator generic!

FF3_ag6RO7G0PGe48CQAEQ.text: My wife and I came here for lunch and neither meal was very good. She had a chicken enchilada and I had a chili rellano. Hers was dry and didn't taste good mine was a chili wrapped in a dry tortilla with sauce on it. Ow well. Back to looking.

KCywqaVqpzeOOuDypZ5BLw.text: We decided to try this place recently on a week night. The place was about half full of patrons. We were seated right away, but the server took a long time to take our order. The food was lousy. My taco meat was so hard that I could not even saw off pieces to eat. I would be ashamed to serve anyone such inedible food. We had to hail down the server for drink refills. Between the poor service and mediocre food, we see no reason to return to this place, with so many good/great Mexican restaurants from which to choose.

7K9qc6qe8a6GDWNXe9ej6w.text: A small quaint one of a kind great tasting Mexican restaurant.  I had the green corn tamales and a chili rellano with chicken over it. Made to perfection. The complimentary chips were hot and fresh and the mild salsa was flavorful.  Definitely need to go there  again.

I9fDnzpxFSyAJ2PeGMg-1w.text: Hello? Taste? Where are you? Not here at la Fonda del sol. Tacos are so bland I couldn't finish them. Zero taste. Not recommended. This is AZ tons of Mexican available that is amazing. Avoid this place if you can. And if you can't... avoid it anyway.

c3u-xKTO2LYYQwI9VJm3SA.text: Margarita just okay. Food not to our liking and as others have posted very loud bordering on annoying. We asked to be moved and staff seemed not to care that we were there to have an enjoyable dinner. Door and wall to the kitchen unclean. Had much better food for far less.

QkzNLYsdgjt2F_m5kR430g.text: Hole in the Wall that has been in Scottsdale a long time. Not very large so go in on slow time. Great food, great salsa and just as good margaritas. Visiting in Scottsdale, must try- Inexpensive!

xGwIqHjX6aY1r0UXptte4g.text: I've been eating here for nearly 40 years. Always consistent food. BEST Carna Asada burro on the planet. Hands down.

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

bMDhF-7WAlAnfCQP0Rz3jg.text: A True gem in the Shea corridor over by Scottsdale road.  The food is probably the best Mexican I have had in Scottsdale  for the last 10 years.  Portions are generous and delicious, am sorry it took this long to find it!

oPWsycBues9VEIwOVT8tLg.text: We ordered take out from here for a work lunch and it was a huge hit! Everything we had was absolutely great! We ordered the queso dip & guac as appetizers (they forgot to give us the guac and I didn't realize until I got back to the office) but we weren't disappointed after we tried the queso :)  Our lunches ranged from shrimp salads, to enchiladas, to fajitas and we really enjoyed everything!  We also ordered the sopapillas and churros for dessert and they were enjoyed as well! The churros were a bigger hit though!  Portions are really big and prices are great. I'd highly recommend checking this place out!  Their salsa's are also really good!!

jElwDR6-k211KLzUNUwrnQ.text: Small place, but very yummy food. The staff was very quick and friendly. Also tons of parking in the back. I highly recommend eating at this restaurant.

nG9EJKA-jihUXkMvHnL9hw.text: We love this place, so much so that I kinda want to give it 1 star to deter you. Valley-raised, this is my 2nd favorite Mexican food restaurant here. Chips are steaming hot and cheese enchilada will have you wishing for another. Note: no brunch or lunch buffets on Sunday.

raJuxaAF6c7Is0WIuLueBw.text: Good food, not a fancy place but it is clean and had good food.   You will not be disappointed.  With so many options in the area they would not have survived for so many years without good food.  Give them a try.   Lots of regular customers.

Rvri1GrCRcJaw9OF0o9L2A.text: Some of the best Mexican food I've had.  We had take out with tacos which were to die for and steak fajitas with lime.  The Salsa is excellent with medium mixed with hot.  We went there on recommendation by Luis Gonzalez. Rename the Fajitas to "Gonzo Fajitas".

gC2nyScFAPhBOCw2Y8E4mQ.text: We tried this place while visiting AZ and the Scottsdale area. We were not disappointed.  As good as it gets. Big chicken quesadilla, could feed 2 people, my son enjoyed it very much. Wonderful enchiladas with bean and rice. Great friendly service, despite the fact that we were on the late side, they were not very busy. Thank you yelper for the great advise!!

NH6ZjN5hZOJYfFeh1vrs1w.text: This is the 2nd time this week while in Phoenix on business. From chips and salsa, to food and drink and service? EXCELLENTE!

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

1QEmFoDQCoXKOc4yIeixqA.text: First time we came to this place and have to say it was great! Green corn tamales were great and the pollo fundido is yummy. Check this place out if you have a chance.

9QLCk0kg-c-LWwC__etVvQ.text: Loved this small, intimate place. Great service.  Margaritas were prepared by the bartender and not pre-made. We ordered the green corn tamale, shrimp enchilada, beef tacos and chicken enchilada all with green chili. Generous portions. Hot sauce is hot and spicy as it should be. They offer a mild salsa as well. Only criticism is the hard taco shells seemed a little tough and were served in the enchilada sauce on the same plate so we're soft on the bottom. Definitely a place to keep on our list of favorites!

wgNmWoZv72f634KDW_6HMg.text: Walked in at 11am and ordered beef burro to go.  It had shredded beef and came with side of salsa and side of some red chilli sauce and a bag of fresh tortilla chips. The salsa/Pico and red sauce were good.  The beef was good but it was watery because it was stewed in onions, tomatoes, celery and ??? It was tasty but it got the burro soggy after awhile...eat it fast and get plenty of napkins. or ask for more foil to hold it together.

Sb26pUSf9fryU0whQYKA5w.text: I love this place! I always go to Tee Pee because I forgot La Fonda was up here on Shea and Scottsdale Road. Their food is just as good, if not better, than Tee Pee's.  I had the number six, which came with four separate items. I definitely like the chips better here. They are lighter and don't fill you up as much. The food is really reasonably priced, and it's a great atmosphere. It is a total "old-school" Mexican food restaurant in Arizona. Check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Here&#39;s the bar. Old school!
Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Here&#39;s the full menu!

uPKDGalfl17tmmYO9RI47A.text: I used to be a regular, but moved away which was why I was happy to come back a few days ago. I really wish i could give this place 4 stars, but the lack of good customer service won't allow me to. Not getting my order right is kind of expected as we see the wait staff rush around the place like crazy. If they could slow it down a bit, they'd be able to get things  right the first time so that everyone in the same party can eat at the same time. I ordered a chicken and spinach enchilada and only got spinach. Boo. Then they took it back and brought it out super fast with chicken on the side. Plus, the cheese dip came late and with the rest of the meal. I dont care to go back for a long time.

y_4PNuFYq0WNaiNqaMam3w.text: Found this place through Yelp app.  It was awesome...literally like a hole in the wall joint, which usually means good food. I got the chicken chimi and my husband got the burrito.  All dinners come with rice and beans and I think most entrees in the $10-14 range.  Portions are huge, plates are extremely hot and the beers are cold.  Service was a little slow but no biggie, we weren't in a hurry.  Highly recommend!

1TZzcl_bUHz8_OTWlv5uYQ.text: This is our favorite "authentic" Mexican food!  I've  been going to La Fonda (original location on Scottsdale Road/Curry) for over 45+ years  The food is wonderful! I love the green corn tamales! My husband loves the MaryLou. My grown kids like  chicken enchiladas with green sauce!  And all of us LOVE the fresh, hot chips and fabulous salsa!

fTj804uGiil7KADGt-fE6g.text: I came to this place based on the reviews and the pictures that looked pretty good, however, that was not the case. This place is by far the worst Mexican food restaurant that I have ever tried, def. not authentic Mexican food. We ordered chicken and the chicken was so burnt that it was so hard. The fries were also burnt that they were just stiff. The carne asada burrito tasted like old meat and over used oil and the tortillas were terrible.

3tQXM-8zqf9jTNBHv7DrMg.text: While in Scottsdale for Thanksgiving, the family opted to go out for Mexican Food one night. Not only was I excited to sample some of Arizona's notorious Mexican cuisine, but who am I to turn down a free meal? Star 1 - How was the service and atmosphere? While not overly packed on the Wednesday evening that my party of six visited, service seemed a bit on the rushed side. While our particular server (who appeared to possibly the the owner) was very nice, the she seemed to be ushering us along quite quickly. While not enough to warrant a star deduction, this should probably be noted. Star Granted. Star 2 - How were the portions relative to the cost? As far as the selection goes, La Fonda is pretty much on par with any of the basic Mexican joints that I've encountered in Colorado or Los Angeles. However, while the menu had a decent selection, mostly combinations of Tacos, Enchiladas, Burritos and Platters, prices were very much on the high side. I opted to go for the Machaca Dinner, and for $13.50 pre-tax, this is what I received: yelp.com/user_local_phot... Hm. Yes, that's a decent amount of meat, but I'd certainly say no more than $6 or $7 worth. That being the case, roughly $6 was spent on basic Spanish rice and beans? Yikes. Even for gourmet Mexican, that's too much. No Star Granted. Stars 3/4 - How was the food? While I wasn't disappointed with my meal, it was by no means the best Mexican I've ever had. The Machaca was very dry (overly crunchy at some points, and the rice and beans were nothing special. Especially paying $13.50? Quality needs to be bumped up a bit. Single Star Granted. Star 5 - Would you eat it every day if you could? With the truly vast number of Mexican options in the Scottsdale/Phoenix area, I can't say there's any way I could make La Fonda Del Sol a daily stop due to high prices and mediocre food and service. No Star Granted.

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Machaca Dinner: $13.50 Pre-Tax

RTHjDwmqLc3FQCiYDiSCeg.text: Been a customer since 1991. Totally crave this place and not many others compare. Shredded beef taco and Chimi special are superior. Chips served warm and are light and crispy. Yum!!! Accented by the best salsas. Great food and large portions.
