Y1CDLTdU1Y5Gq_hfob8jOA.text: This is definitely a hidden gem! My boyfriend and I have seen this place on Yelp for awhile and we are so glad we finally tried it. The food was super fresh and delicious! Can't wait to come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

7S4iypZVJesJKowHy6ypUg.text: I've been searching a long time for amazing Mexican food in Scottsdale and finally found it!!! Wow, wow, wow!! Delicious and fabulous and a new craving! Even when I order it through uber eats it's delicious! Best Mexican food around!

wgLvyh6BEad8E4YSczbVLw.text: We have been here a few times before and just realized ive never left a review for them.  This place is truly a diamond in the rough for Scottsdale hidden on Scottdale and Shea.   The salsa Is flavorful and fresh, sooo good. My favorite is the chicken fundido, highly recommend. I posted a pic too.  Staff is attentive and at 6:30 there are few booths available,  don't let that discourage you.... Just tells you its great.  I know another post commented on the ventilation,  no idea wth they are talking about. Place does not smell, it's old but it's clean. Try it... It's worth my 20 min drive!

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Fundido, very flavorful. Highly recommend

FoYjpPRnd3mEpMOBS9h7rw.text: I have been a regular at La Fonda del Sol for a while now and absolutely love the food here. The service is always great. love love love. (The margaritas are great too;)

XvPP7l5tdbsYD9JcCt_OMA.text: Excellent Mexican food, some of the best I've had. I'd recommend this as a casual place to eat, not a date night atmosphere. My husband & I will be returning!

I_MvpGBbTUE-AugKmgfEew.text: Was in a bit of a rush so we tried their buffet. It really was 1 step below a happy hour taco bar. There were no tortillas, 15 min wait after alerting them they brought out 5. The selection of items makes it tough to find even 2 things you would want (I'm not being picky, I know it's a buffet). I really hate to sound this harsh, but it really was not good and had no value for money. If this is the level they can provide for the price they should just discontinue it. I probably won't return even though menu items might be better, the experience left me so dissapointed I can't find a reason to try again.

HL7025MNR5T512Zvg1w3Cg.text: It has been 3 days since we dined at LaFonda Del Sol and I can't remember much about the food except the chips and salsa (which were very good!).   The ambiance is hole in the wall-esque. The food and service were obviously not too bad because I would have remembered that but also not so awe-inspiring that I have vivid recall about what we ate.   The concierge did not lead us totally astray but it is safe to say that the restaurant is eminently forgettable.

pQ2wuQ_ppyd29ZM1CR3dMQ.text: The only place to go for Mexican food. I'll drive out of my way to come here. Cannot ever get enough of the salsa. The BEST in town.

nLsHZXfVCaWVo15WqOOg1Q.text: Customer for 20 years.  Never will go near the place again.  On Saturday nite, Management allowed a drunken, roudy, over the top obnoxious, loud group of young men and women ruin everyone's dinner!! Manager laughed at me when I complained!!

MQ8Y9uyifY4Un3BGa3iQYg.text: Been eating here for years and it's always been the same, authentic delicious Mexican food that you just don't get everywhere. Roman, the head waiter, is always prompt, courteous, and in a delightful mood like he has always been for the years he's worked there, and being a engineer I know the old cliche is True "good help is hard to find" thanks for the years of great food at a great price!

GrKBuv7A_-Rn03cy_B7g0w.text: So the hubs and I moved here three weeks ago and on our first weekend here we wandered by La Fonda but the wait on a Friday night was just something we weren't in the mood for (45 minutes -1 hour)...we learned quickly this was the norm as it wasn't the first place we tried but the second with the same wait time....  Sooooo, we decided to give it a shot on a random Sunday around 5ish and hopefully find our go to Mexican joint in the neighborhood.   The chips are fresh and crisp and PERFECT, the salsa was on point as well. I appreciate they brought out a spicy and mild. I found the perfect combo to be 1 part spicy to 3 parts mild .  The queso dip isn't something we will order again. It tasted like straight velveeta but it came with what I think we're fried flour tortillas and those were the best part of the app.  My husband and I both ordered the la Fonda special chimichanga (chicken, cream cheese, jalapeno cheese) don't get me wrong, it was ok, just not something I'll order again. However, the defried beans ... Yes please! Wow wow wow.  All in all I'm not impressed but since it's less than 5 minutes away i know I'll give it another try.

bLoBurrDQ2GWAPSabJjFfA.text: I went to La Fonda Del Sol with a group of 14.  We were put in a room that was acoustically challenging.  Voices just bounced off the walls so you could here anyone talk.  I ordered the beef taco and cheese enchilada.  Boy have I tasted better.  The beef was greasy and tasted kind of foul.  The cheese enchilada was drowning in cheese that I couldn't find the enchilada.  Oh, the refried beans???  Canned.  Yuck.  Someone asked for another tortilla and they were charged $3.00.  They were not told by the waitress that there would be an extra charge.  And when the person asked about the charge the assistant manager came over and actually started arguing with the person.  Such poor customer service for a darn tortilla.  Expensive for the low quality of food.  I definitely will not be going back.

8Povi1RMiXj4x4jZJrAQiA.text: Disclaimer...This is not street food style Mexican. La Fonda is a sit down chips and salsa restaurant. It's significantly less Tex Mex than most places in AZ and is more like sit down places in southern CA   The plates don't have excessive cheese so the meal is much less heavy and greasy. They don't kill it with too much sauce and the overall plate is not salty. The person who assisted me seemed to be the owner and she was so gracious and welcoming. The bar looked really comfortable and the wasn't too loud. It looks like a great place to watch a Suns game...If watching the Suns could ever be considered great. Seating is booth style and kind of dark.,,very cool vibe. The staff seemed like they were happy to be there and happy to have me there. If I lived in AZ I would be a frequent customer. Highly recommended.

vIPQIuKPIng9Xmxmkz7DrQ.text: I have not even eaten yet but the hospitality is 5 stars. Their salsas are great and everyone has a genuine smile for you !  Ok food is here and the tamales are yummy and comforting

1WvzCgyBRW8OyppXgtcoLA.text: Someone asked me about a review of another Mexican restaurant which warranted a one-star from me.  Seems like several other people love the place.  Glad it satisfies them, and even more glad I have La Fonda to eat at.  La Fonda del Sol -- the restaurant of the sun, I believe -- has been around forever.  I never went there -- it's in a very old shopping center at SE Shea and Scottsdale, and it's a well-worn place.  For whatever reason, a friend suggested we meet up there about a year ago.   What a gem!  From 11 to 2 (maybe 3) they have a buffet in addition to their regular menu.  Is there anything on the buffet that is not delicious!  (Well, the menudo. I hate menudo.  Honestly never tried La Fonda's menudo, but as long as they call it menudo, I'll hate it.  If you like menudo, it's probably very good.)  Starting with chicken in red sauce, then green chile enchiladas, cheese enchiladas. tilapia, chicken fajitas, shredded beef, etc.  Excellent pico de gallo.  An array of beans, jalapenos, and relishes.  Fruits and pudding for dessert.  I'm good for three plates and dessert.  Oh, and the chips and salsa at the table are great, too.  My friend is of Mexican descent -- a great grandfather came to the States running from Poncho Villa -- says the food is just like his mother used to make.  Dunno about that.  All I know is it's great.

eqteHy4gQKdejM5XVzRn3A.text: Amazing food any day of the week!!!  Super friendly service and excellent chip and salas at the start of the meal.  Mixing the hot and mild is the best way to go!! Ask for an extra dish for it!  The jalapeno cream cheese of the chimichanga is to die for... unfounded at any other Scottsdale Mexican joint!!!

p7V4u5EQL6EsMHjV2RVLhQ.text: Very good Mexican food and fresh hot tortilla chips! It's been years since I've been here but was glad the food is still top notch. I ordered the chicken fundido with beans and rice and my spouse had the chicken enchiladas with rice and beans. Both were delicious and filling. Will be back again for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ETF68O_pmR2QdgT9948YlQ.text: When you're treated like family from the moment you walk in it's hard to be objective about the food. Two hard tacos, green corn tamale and a 32oz Diet Coke to go and I'm on my way. The tacos were PERFECT, the tamale was out of this world. I'll be back every Wednesday night for to-go for the next decade. Thanks G and my new La Fonda Family!

Uz9ftnp6Vs2aHmiEIhjHTA.text: This is a pretty traditional Mexican restaurant - big hot plates with orange rice, refried beans with cheese, and some standard entree - i.e. flautas, chimichangas or fajitas.  The margaritas are not special (taste like a mix or a pre-bottled version).  So why do I like it?  Because it's one of those little family run places with a great one-of-a-kind atmosphere.  Because the chips come warm and with two kinds of salsa.  Because the staff cares and makes you feel at home.   I go for the atmosphere and the perfectly adequate food.  Incidentally - the flautas were overcooked - crunchy, but the fajitas were quite good.

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The interior, loaded with character from another time
Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The storefront - facing an interior parking lot off of Shea

gR_qazAy4Td8JbWzaGhDCw.text: I used to babysit for the previous owner's kids when I was a teen and they'd bring home La Fonda food for their children, but never give me any and I'd be so jealous. I was always curious about this restaurant's food so I finally tried it. It was just okay. In fact, I'd give 2 stars but the rest of my family liked it so I'm giving 3.  My chicken taco was dry and bland. The red enchilada sauce had no flavor at all. The salsa was super yummy and fresh, though.   I won't ever go back - primarily because their ceiling fans cause the lights to flicker, which can trigger migraines, and which I'm prone to. If you get migraines, steer clear!

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sri chicken taco and flavorless chicken enchilada

6Oi729_g755Rnx-5TuyZsw.text: Did not listen to my order request, delivery driver was rude, ordered consome and they gave me caldo and salsa had way too much onion

Jjffl9UOKjHxwiy9LiSfAw.text: Consistently outstanding Sonoran Mexican Food. Always consistent and great service. Machaca is outstanding as is the grilled shrimp burrito

qe4psEVflspfIBF-cKC30w.text: For the authentic taste of a good hearty Mexican meal, this is my go-to spot. They have an abundance of vegetarian options which are surprisingly hard to find at Mexican restaurants around the valley. I almost always opt for the nachos because their jalapenos are awesome.   The chips are amazing: crispy, not too greasy, and perfectly thin. But the salsa? Oh my god. SO good!   Another rad thing about this place: the margarita pitchers. Makes for a great time with friends. I'm a classic margarita kind of gal so I didn't venture too far out of my comfort zone, but they definitely gave me a good buzz.  The kicker here is the service. The family that owns this place is so nice they warm your heart!

YRR2DbGnOqd0Iu4jd0E0sQ.text: This is one of my favorite if not my favorite distance to home. It's your basic Arizona hole in the wall place. When you walk in you feel like they have been here for years. Which is proof that it's good because of it wasn't they wouldn't have lasted this long. My favorite thing to order is a crispy chicken taco and cheese enchilada. Standard stuff but always better than every other place in the city I try. Service is generally very good. Even the Diet Coke seems to always taste right. Talking about it I might have to head over now

4kCBaHa7Zhf_uzjV0mQsLQ.text: Met some friends last night for dinner.  Greeted promptly, great little outside seating area.  Cold beers, crisp chips, fresh and delicious salsa.   Ordered a simple Carne Asada burro with some pico inside.  My wife ordered the Miniature Combo. Both were excellent.  Great place for North Scottsdale.  Oh yeah, very reasonable prices!!!  Cheers

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My Carne Asada &amp; Pico Burro wth some salsa on top and cut up perfectly.

fgKN_nvIwJbm7Z_j2XW0XA.text: Bridgett was the BEST!  She let us know when Happy Hour was ending (2-5) so we could get one more Dos Equis at the HH price. This is one of the only places in the NE valley to get a ground beef taco, so if you prefer ground beef tacos, come here. The Machaca plate is solid and you get 2 large tortillas with the plate. They also automatically brought both hot and mild salsa with the chips. Great dinner!

apQR2Bf-KpC8G146oRk63A.text: Food was pretty good, but the time it took from ordering my dinner till it came to me was unacceptable.  Wasn't worth the 35 minute wait.  Yes the place was crowded, but how long does it take to build one taco and assemble a chicken enchilada in a Mexican restaurant.

GkNGMul5t9dTk-GH5AClgg.text: This place is busy for a reason. I've had the lunch buffet which was fantastic. Great selection! I also have had dinner ( Chicken enchiladas ). The portions are large and the food tasty! Service is good also. They have a small outdoor area where you can bring your pooch. Highly recommend

nXUzpWtITDXB1Sfka_Dojw.text: ok, moved here from cali like so many others, tried many mexican restaurants, then found this place. oh my!  they know how to cook, machata, off the charts, salsas, crazy good!  just the simpicity of the refried beans are delicious, a bit of a drive from my cave creek house but will make the hike weekly, hats off, awestruck, great service too,

eLe8FXgVUjIITeN-Ai5c2Q.text: I don't remember how/when I discovered La Fonda more than twenty years ago, but La Fonda is without a doubt one of my favorite restaurants. Nothing fancy about the place (it's been there near the corner of Shea and Scottsdale Roads longer than I can remember) but they offer friendly service and good Mexican food with that family flare and consistent favorite dishes. I love the chips and two salsas served when you arrive, and one of their margaritas (I tend to order a blue one) hits the spot on a Friday night. When my son comes home from college, it's always on his list.

MIBjiLGQecaqbL4i1C1vRQ.text: Came here for lunch with a co-worker. Started with chips and 2 kinds of salsa. One was a traditional mild salsa, the other was blazing hot, which made me very happy. The beef enchilada was awesome. I ordered 1 a la carte, and it was plenty of food. My co-worker had beef flautas and loved them. We arrived just as they opened, and when we left, the place was packed. Obviously the locals know it's great authentic Mexican food.

fgI_t2oFZpD6-pWVUhEIlA.text: This place has been here forever which is a testament to their good food.  A little pricey, but solid old school Sonoran Mexican food.  Started with the chips & salsa... delish!  Followed by a Cheese Crisp...delish!  I had a Bean & Spinach Burrito & my Aunt had a Chicken Chimichanga...both delish!  4 stars because as it got busier the noise level got annoying. We hurried up & paid instead of ordering another drink.  Not sure anything they can do with the building acoustics...I would go again at an off hour to have a more relaxing meal.

MaDowK41cs_yWCPQwICIrw.text: This is really good Mexican food on a budget. The decor is standard, the service is wonderful, and the food is amazing. I have been to this location several times and have been pleased with everything I have ever ordered. The tostadas and the chimichingas really stand out in my memory.  Their chips and salsa are some of the best I have tasted.

e8YclCO2FmKsr9eoz7yv1w.text: A bit drizzly on Thurs. when we ended up here it was a bit before 3 the place was empty maybe 2 other customers while we were there. We were greeted by a nice lady who asked how many I replied 2 1/2 in Spanish she replied in to sit where we pleased. I wish it would have been nice out that day their patio looked like fun....maybe another day for happy hour yeah. My daughter loved the fish tank I just hope the catfish wasn't for eating later!! Yikes it was way too big for the tank and looked a bit out of place with the other goldfish.  Hot chips and 2 carafes of salsa came out w our waiter one hot and one not. YAY just how I like it!! I liked to mix them here to get the perfect amount of heat I like it was yummy the chips could have been a tad better some were a little too toasted. I had a chile relleno lunch their beans and rice were great no complaints the egg on the relleno was a little too peppery for me but I dont like pepper too much yet I still cleaned my plate. My mom had an enchilada she ate it up quick and the kid's plate was so cute w a mini taco my daughter liked that she could put the not hot salsa in the taco and eat it! =) Quick and very pleasant service. Could use a little dusting pics coming soon.

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chile Relleno Plato
Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Enchilada Lunch Plato
Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kid&#39;s taco plato

s6-lLKE4k_sBHKIYWg2BdQ.text: We ended up here because it was almost 9PM on a week night.  First time and we had a bogo coupon from the entertainment guide as well.  We both loved everything.  Being the last customers for the night I totally expected the staff to be butthurt but they weren't.  Everyone we encountered smiled and was friendly.  Several other tables emptied and it was close to closing time, the mop never came out, they didn't start flipping the chairs upside down on the tables. I had the La Fonda Chimi which was wonderful.  He had the chicken fajitas and they came with the usual on a separate plate. I loved the guacamole and the salsa. The chips were hot and fresh. I will definitely be back!

OSq-baTSBDS9sfRMGKmHWA.text: When they bring the chips and salsa, ask for a straw.  Stick it in the mild salsa container and suck until the container is empty.  This will be the culinary height of the meal.  I ordered the Armando Combination so that I could try different things.  Don't do that.  I heard a waitress suggest the Carne Burrito.  Too late for my order.  The food, simply said, was bland.  The mild salsa was a medley of fresh ingredients in just the right mix.  Awesome.   The interior was classic small Mexican restaurant.  The service was fine.  Honestly, another visit is necessary to make a final decision.  But until then, I have to agree with Kansas G.  So, if you came for the food review, you can move on.  If you are interested in a little social commentary, please read on.  [Steps up on soapbox]  1) I really wish someone had warned me that this was "loud talker night" at La Fonda.  I'd have gone tomorrow.  2) Memo to the F-bomb boys across the restaurant: This isn't a saloon or some spit on the floor, get piss drunk night out at the pool hall.  So could you please keep the F-bomb laced conversation for the ride home?  I realize you were here on "loud talker night" but that only intensified the offensiveness.  Don't get me wrong, I love a great profanity-laced conversation as much as the next guy, just not at dinner.  3) While I'm sure that you believe that the $3.95/month you're paying for that shitty and annoying ringtone is a great investment, Harley-wearin'-F-bomb dude, I don't want to hear it at dinner.  Put the F-er on F-ing vibrate, please.  Does that help?  4) And then, once you answer the shitty ringtone call, please realize that the dude on the other end of the line does not hear you any better if you YELLLLL.  Of course I do, complete with the F-bombs.  [Stands down from soapbox]  What the hell is happening to our manners?  Thanks for listening.

FtL_6E5PvjIXOt7IjOtiiw.text: The food is still great here but we've stopped going. I don't know if it is the ventilation but the way you smell afterwards is just too incredibly strong and yucky.

pOz-Ek7Z90ftfMoXxGkadw.text: Went here while on vacation after doing extensive research to find an authentic Mexican restaurant near our hotel. Each of us had a different mixed plate to try as much as possible. All the foods were delicious and the tortillas before the meal were a bit addicting. Ended up taking half of our meals back to the hotel for lunch the next day.

Q55b8YQFjkdAjcvD8TV6Dg.text: Great experience my first time there. Prompt service and waiter was very friendly and attentive to our large crowd. I ordered the steak chimichanga and the meat was amazing, wasn't greasy surprisingly since it's deep fried! This is definitely my go to spot and worth my drive from chandler.

pJ3R5XXUPLr8d-eAlWKSmw.text: This is a pretty darn good "come as you are"  Sonoran Mexican food joint. The food quality and portion size is good; chunky chicken in the enchilada, machaca was well seasoned and robust, tap dos Equis Amber was super cold in a frosty mug. Made us happy for $25.

RLloaPnzpuhx3OgXBMDJ9w.text: Nice atmosphere, has an enclosed patio, the buffet is good, reasonable prices. Will return. But some of the enchilada dishes are a bit runny but still good.

3z_2ZQZNQiNjSjyZX0HCFg.text: My husband loves the food, however, I don't care for it.  Service is great but something is missing.

EG-uzAQv_74tqRbTGFua1w.text: If La Fonda Del Sol existed in New York City, there would be a line around the block waiting to get seats. The irony, of course, is that Arizonans consider this to be perfectly passable Mexican food, but a far cry from palate-pleasing perfection. I suppose I find myself bitter knowing that such deliciousness could be viewed with such a blase indifference by Phoenix's elite critics; in New York, we still seek out the one True answer to the Mexican food problem, yet in Phoenix, the answer is so abundant it produces disenchantment.  Well, friends, we'd gladly take your La Fonda Del Sol. You get to keep the rest of those Mexican restaurants you love, so it's only a minor loss. In exchange, you may have a Rosa Mexicana and a Dos Caminos. Nay, don't thank me.  So, La Fonda.... Truly spicy, homemade salsa; perfectly crisp chile rellenos bathed in cheese, crusty chimichangas battered in love and ambrosia, husk-wrapped tamales that taste homemade; huge portions, incredibly low prices. This is what it's all about.  Yeah, the tacky pastel Mexican decorations are unnerving and the service is slow and often panicked, but these are minor gripes.  When it's all said and done, these idiots forklift themselves into the waiting lines of NYPD Pizza (HA! HAHAHA!) and Oregano's (BAHH! HAHA!) while overlooking the real gem that sits in between them. Well, if you're a New Yorker like me, you're not gonna try either of those wrecks anyhow; go get some Mexican.

e-ODuJ4VZ-WTyoBFYQicSw.text: Another fantastic dinner! Never disappointed here! Seriously, the best Mexican food! Awesome and quick service! My favorite is the green chicken enchilada...mmm! I'm stuffed!

DEK4RTIZPzucwYO3x7aV6A.text: Love this place!!  The food is spot on and the service is always perfect!  I normally get the combo which has a beef enchilada, beef tamale and a beef taco!! I have three words to describe it: FAB-U-LOUS!!!!! The margaritas aren't bad either!!! Oh Yeah! The chips and salsa are awesome!!

oX5INCWxyjgGcKMk3GpSig.text: We went there valentines night I guess they weren't expecting that many people and I also think they were short staffed. Our server was Andrew hope I'm getting the name right. Young guy with brown hair and glasses absolutely amazing. For how slammed that poor guy was customer service his attitude and his attention to detail was outstanding. The queso is amazing I would just say to serve it though with regular chips not a fan of the flour crisps. Their chips and salsa are probably the best in the valley except for maybe los dos molinos but that is very far from where we live. son got the Carne asada wow the meet is so tender and great flavor. Other son bean burrito  fine husband Carnitas very good. My only negative feedback is I ordered the chili relleno and it was definitely not the best I've had. The batter used to coat it is very odd it's like a crusty omelette s/b fluffy and soft and the chile itself inside was too crispy it should be cooked thoroughly & easy to cut w/ a fork. However the ranchero sauce is very good maybe they can work on the other 2 issues. But not everything can be perfect so I'm OK with it. Next time I think I'll order the beef hard taco that's my other go to. I love that they serve Coke products I mean who serves Pepsi products anymore? I will continue to go here with my family and each time I'll try something different until I figure out what my favorites are

wRZJaDMX_07EVCIvf0y6sw.text: Hi there,   I LOVE this place !!!!!!!!    The waiters have been there forever  and are always friendly and helpful and knowledgeable !   THE food is consistent and fresh and not out of a can.     My nephew 12 years old said,  "this is the best Mexican food I ever tasted".   He goes out with his parents all the time and thinks this tastes best. I go there at least 3 times a week and everyone I take makes it their favorite.  Peacock

668-BEzx9Y9KykLjbtwyag.text: When in Scottsdale AZ on the corner of Scottsdale road and Shea you will find this place and not be disappointed . I had the Grande Tostada loaded with Carne Asada, Warm beans and all that goes with a Tostada. The Margareta's are top notch and not watered down. Give it a try--it's well worth the trip. Ron G

FLsM_wOpVhdEFbDX1Vd5YA.text: For that Mexican craving that no other  food type can satisfy, La Fonda reigns supreme. There is nothing upscale or arty about the plate they set in front of you, but it's solid, reliable and essential on occasion. My two favorites are the green corn tamale dinner and their cheese chile relleno. Cheese crisp or hot buttered flour tortilla also key players on sidelines. They've been around the Valley in a couple different locations since the '70's, geez just go.

2CRQ95pKeKYUEAq6I-ZS7w.text: Skip the frozen margaritas!  This rating doesn't reflect the food b/c my Mom and I just went for a cool margarita and some chips and salsa.  Margs have a strange after taste and the salsa is very bland. Also, what's up with the flies? Seriously, the waitress was walking around with a fly swatter! (I'm not kidding) Their only redeeming quality during our visit was the waitress was very pleasant.

4LgtG6mL1SyWFyf1N1DLOQ.text: I love this place so much that I get take out from here on a weekly basis.  If I have company that want to go to authentic local food (nothing fancy), then I head to La Fonda.  Easy to get in.  Nothing fancy, but good food and good service.  Their servers have been there a while and always remember me which is a nice touch.  Their tamales are made fresh and are DELICIOUS.  Their salsa is fresh and yummy.  The place is "old Scottsdale" for sure, but you will enjoy it.  There are always a lot of people eating, but I never seem to have to wait.

NkluugM6ahGqd0QVeZohUQ.text: If you like chain restaurants that have ridiculous Mexican chilis dressed with a sombrero on their head then you'll hate this place.  If you like great service, authentic Mexican food, free chips and salsa that are homemade (plenty of cilantro and peppers), then it's tough to beat La Fonda del Sol.  It's not fancy, but the service was fantastic and food dynamite.    The service was fantastic, they were busy, but both our waiter and person serving water was around twice as much as you'd find in most Mexican restaurants that charge twice as much.  A previous poster said the salsa was good.  I agree.  It comes out with hot and mild, or mix it for a good combination of both.  The dishes were well proportioned and authentic - I didn't get the usual velveeta cheese taste like you will at chain Mexican restaurants.  I ordered the #1 combo which came out with great beans and rice.  Throw in some of that hot salsa on there and you can't miss!  The bonus for the night was listening to the staff cheer during the Mexico/US soccer game.  I take it Mexico won as there was a lot of cheering.  Order a margarita or tecate and enjoy yourself here!

35KsGUzYLKapHi-fWzc9Zg.text: Great prices, great food, great taste, great staff...no horchata or Jamaica though! Nonetheless, the reason for the 4 stars is I've had better not-too-far, though for the immediate area they are probably the best in the 1-1.5 mile radius though, including "the one across the street" (so far, my opinion).

ncHhkO6KMDm14cV-UReOGw.text: Great service here food is decent but I've had better. ..complimentary salsa was really good. .happy with my visit

BSppdkZdiexJzKfNAeZIBQ.text: Their chips and salsa are the best I've had! The chips come with a bottle of regular salsa and hot salsa, and they are generous to refill anything you need! The regular salsa is chock full of tomatoes, onions, cilantro...yum....mix in some of the hotter salsa on your plate and it's perfect!   I had their 2 chicken enchilada plate, no beans extra rice. It was really good, although it was cubes of chicken, rather than shredded chicken which I'm used to. Tasty, nonetheless, lol I'm just being overly picky :P Their rice was cooked well, and it came with a nice little side of lettuce and tomatoes.  All in all, a great plate of food! It was a tiny bit pricey...around $13.  But I really enjoyed my food! Service was great. My sister-in-law and I went on a Sunday afternoon around 3pm, and there were only a few other tables. They don't have horchata though :(

Cw4MEGk2kgqmCUO7QSV3aA.text: Definitely have had much better mexican food. Not real flavorful.

bLPz7ytz23gtZfV4gSSJqQ.text: Enjoying lunch at this long established Mexican restaurant. Combo plate chicken chimy hot and mild salsas with fresh chips.

OCw5xIe_KDEOqrFMqMrfpw.text: This place is always packed & for good reason...from the fresh, tasty salsa to the outstanding sizzling fajitas to the tacos, burritos, to the chimis to the amazing margaritas to the friendly, homey service...this place has it all!!! I've lived in Scottsdale for over 40 years & have eaten in dozens of Mexican food places...La Fondas is, by far, the most delicious! You can taste & see the freshness at LaFondas...If you're in the mood for made-from-scratch delicious food where the owners appreciate your business, this is the place for you! Annamarie R.

CdJx2RnUlWA3BUJWy_2AfQ.text: Decent food, not authentic Mexican food but it is filling, salsas are a little better than the Salsa Picante Pace, waiter was helpful but since they were closing, was a bit pushy to get us out, place closes at 9pm which is strange where I come from, all Mexican restaurants close at 1 or 2 AM, kind of disappointed at Mexican food in this town

8jOwi-k26IFJzVybWZMV8Q.text: My new favorite Mexican restaurant! Easy to drive by, and not much to look at, but outstanding food, service, and value.

W2ea6k9UoeLwzKMQ0tF-kA.text: I have heard about this place for years. This past weekend we decided to try it. It was obvious that if you are a regular, you are treated quite well. The servers knew the names of the customers and treated them like they were part of the family. Our server acted like we were from outer space. In fairness I did not see him interact with any other customers, so perhaps he was the issue. The food was good, but there are definitely better Mexican food places in town. Perhaps if this was our normal spot, or we had one of the other servers I would be inclined to try it again. But, it's not and they weren't so we'll probably stick with our usual places.

dKZDpKM6VPab_-xYqwVieQ.text: Place is usually great but not this last time, went in for breakfast which ends at 11, both of us wanted to order huevos rancheros. It was 10:55 & was told we could not get  breakfast the cook had already broken down the kitchen but we could order it off the dinner menu, you get one more egg and and can chili sauce instead I'd the Rancho sauce. it only costs $7.00 more each! Seriously I asked, it's not 11 yet and you can't make us the breakfast huevos. Your sign says breakfast until 11. We sucked it up and ordered since we drive all the way there and to top it off it still came out with the ranchero sauce.  Wanted to speak with owner as I have been going there for the past 12 years but she was not in. Unfortunately it will probably be another a while before I go back or ever recommend it as the best Mexican food in Scottsdale again.  Si much for customer service. This would have never happened had there been a manager on.

Oso3xrMqltUaA9uJ9AJAqA.text: Delicious cheese enchiladas! Also great salsa and I enjoyed their chips and guacamole.

XITTUNi2bsgwqKVoqYlqFw.text: I'm a Phoenix native and I take Mexican food very seriously. I very rarely order red chili when I go out because I love it so much and am usually left sad and disappointed. I'm also an avid taco lover. I'm 7 months pregnant so I would like them every day. The red chili I had at La Fondas today almost brought a tear to my eye. The beef in the chili and the taco was tender and flavorful. Rice and beans yummy. Salsa was ah mazing. My hubby had the fundido and barely spoke as he was so engrossed in the deliciousness. Not close to our Anthem home but I'll go back any opportunity I get.

CQkkZnXoJcSjVuJlRBgCfg.text: Wonderful service - Brittany even asked our names and used them the entire dinner.  Wow!  We loved the warm chips and great salsa, my chimichanga was yum!  Will be heading there again!

GyiZf6pUF_uESnlMxJIe1A.text: La Fonda Del Sol - LOVE it! For us the best Mexican restaurant in Scottsdale. It is authentic. I grew up in Calif enjoying the Calif /Mex food from local friends and this  has that flavor. The FISH TACOS here are AMAZING! Fresh and NONE of that stupid sauce or added fat...these are GRILLED..they are light & tasty. The HOT chips are fantastic, mix the salsas they bring to the table & ask for a small bowl to enjoy. Really a great place...over 25 years in the same location...that tells you something especially in the Restaurant industry. When we are in Scottsdale we eat Mexican here. Good food, good value and good waitstaff. We never thought it would be hard to find good mexican food in Scottsdale, but it is...this is a great place!

7dZJvCo9x5zmKuAbr1L60g.text: Very good food. Not a fancy place but a great place to get good tasting food. The was oven hot. Very fresh.

c26_Xs7L5y1MJiAgp_TCcw.text: I live a few minutes from La Fonda and tried it for the first time last night and I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. From the outside it doesn't really look like anything special, but the food was great and the service was good. I really enjoyed my topoppo salad and their salsas are delicious! I wasn't thrilled with my margarita, but that was my only qualm. I'm happy to have found good Mexican in my neighborhood!

5ZilGypy9MX8PJpOaFzYiQ.text: So the waiter brought a me cheese enchilada and chicken taco even though I ordered a beef enchilada and chicken taco I informed him of this and he looked at me in the face and asked me if I wanted a side of beef.  I will not be back

tSWzbEBGFQrTZG1rAH09kQ.text: La Fonda Del Sol has been in Scottsdale for forever. Yes, the place is definitely run down, however, they have good food. They have a big menu, there's something for everyone. They have fresh warm chips and salsa which I always get filled on because they are so good! Their Chimichanga's are huge and delicious! The portions here are massive so you'll definitely have food to take home. And the staff here is always super nice. Definitely try this place out if you haven't already.

EcmhqZIUWAz55ZaAF-XL8g.text: Went here because I wanted authentic greasy stick to your ribs Mexican food. Unfortunately all I got was the greasy part.   I ordered a combo enchilada and taco platter. The shredded beef was dry and the whole plate was just too salty. It came with an ample helping of beans and rice, which were tasty but nothing special.  However I do have to agree that this place has great chips and salsa. And the wait staff is very generous with them.   I just wish the rest of the meal had lived up to the chips.

AzdeWGEj2SUNM-vLj5eKoQ.text: Good Mexican food not the best Service is kind  Favorite is the chimichanga with sour cream mmm also love their chips

q2g48pNUGLkbkBamdhUAAQ.text: We had a group of about 20 with a reservation at 3pm on a Saturday.  We were only given one server for our entire party. As people were arriving he would get drink orders but after 12 of us were there I did have to ask for chips and salsa since we were only given one bowl.  The food was ok. I ordered cheese enchiladas with green sauce, beans and rice. I ordered an egg on top (my own preference for New Mexican style). The food was hot and while it tasted good, I wished it had had more sauce because you could barely see it.  I felt bad for the server because he had no system to remember who got what dish and he struggled to deliver it correctly.  Overall it was ok. If I go back it will only be because the group chooses to.

2gbTqw1Lk09vNNwMZJg-zQ.text: As counter intuitive as it may seem for someone living in Phoenix, I've actually struggled to find a decent Mexican restaurant as of late. That said, after last night's experience, I think my search may finally be over.   What originally drew me to La Fonda Del Sol, surprisingly, was the architecture. I saw the photos of the exterior and interior arched arches, the exposed brick walls, the wrought iron, the stepped entrance way and the small enclosed patio and I thought that, if nothing else, it certainly looked legit. Appearance wise, this was spot on for what I expect from an authentic Mexican restaurant, and it absolutely reminded me of the places I used to eat at back in the 80s and 90s.   Once we stepped inside, there was yet more retro ambiance to be had. The vinyl booths, arched walkways and murals, even the laminated, tri-fold menus, all screamed 1990s Mexican restaurant. Shortly after we got seated, we were brought a couple of small carafes with house made salsas, and a bowl of fresh, warm chips. The chips were good, and my wife and I liked both of the salsas. Just enough heat in the hot one, and lots of flavor in the milder one. Surprisingly, this is another thing that most places get wrong, so I was happy to see that it was well executed here.   For entrees, we decided on the Flamingo dinner and a large tropical salad. The wait was very reasonable and when the food arrived, it did not disappoint. The chicken in the tropical salad was extremely flavorful and I ended up pinching a few pieces from my wife's plate. As to the Flamingo dinner, it was everything I had hoped it would be: good sized, properly fried chimichanga, guacamole and sour cream on top and plenty of beans and rice, all served piping hot. The chicken in the chimichanga was tender and moist, well seasoned and there was plenty of it to be had. I was sold after the first bite, and promptly devoured the entire thing. This was the chimichanga I had been searching for and not finding anywhere else!   As far as service, I cannot complain about any aspect of it. From the moment we walked in the door, we were greeted promptly and immediately seated. This was followed very shortly by delivery of our chips and salsa and then our fantastic server, Roman, took care of us from that point on. He got our order in quickly, made to sure everything came out right, and always kept our drinks refilled. Absolutely fantastic service.  After last night's experience, I can say without any doubt that my wife and I will be returning as regulars. My only regret is that I did not find this place sooner. If you're looking for authenticity when it comes to a Mexican restaurant experience, look no further, this is the one. Highly recommended!

2vroF-7xkjw_oD7jxDpNPw.text: Had a quick and delicious lunch here today and 3:00 PM was a perfect time to eat here because the restaurant was quite and empty. From the outside it looks just like it does on the inside, nothing fancy, just an older looking building. When walking in it's dimly lit and again there's nothing fancy to the decor except the celebrity lined wall as you enter the restaurant. Dwayne Wade and Gabrielle Union photos are on the wall. Once you get through the entrance we discovered what was waiting inside was worth the quick drive from Fountain Hills.  After putting in our order of 2 beef and cheese enchilada combo plates, our server brought us a hot basket of chips and two choices of salsa, and in small glass containers, one was pico de Gallo style and the other one deemed hot was in puree form. Both were equally delicious and the one the waiter told us was hot, was hot and had a nice spicy kick to it and yes, the more dips of the chips into the salsa the hotter my tongue got.  Within 15 minutes our food order came up and the waiter said "be careful the plate is super hot." Of course what do we do when a waiter says that? We touched the plates and it was truly hot, hot, hot. Lol. I looked at the plate and saw the beef taco was loaded with beef, sliced nicely, cheese and shredded lettuce and the cheese enchilada was gooey with cheese but still firm looking. And if that wasn't enough their was a healthy portion of Spanish rice and refried beans. It had to be at least 2 nice scoops of rice on this combo plate for $9.95. BTW, lunch special is daily, so make sure you ask for it as the lunch menu has a decent variety and nicely priced, even on a Sunday.  The one thing I knew for sure was that the food was gonna be amazing, it looked amazing, was served piping hot (I have a thing about getting served hot food) and once I had a little bite of everything I found that every mouthful was mouthwatering yummy and not so salty. Everything here was just right. If you want a homey, kick back and chill place where you can eat a good, reasonably priced meal try La Fonda, it's a hidden jewel in Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

2Q-axS23epI0GRPqVXJPNA.text: Stopped in for breakfast, holiday weekend. We ate on the patio. Noticed that the patio had not been cleaned or wiped down from the night before. Salsa jars weren't cleaned, old salsa residue on the jar. Waiter was very friendly. Food was decent, a bit overpriced. I had the chorizo & egg burro, tasted good! G had a green chili taco combo plate, taco was bland. Our food was decent, we might give it another try, but if only we were in the area.

RgDr7HHa6f713ac5LT242g.text: Listen up people of Yelp. This is THE Mexican place in Scottsdale. Yes, I am biased. Yes, I have been coming here a LONG time. Yes, my parent's neighbor painted the murals here in the early 90s.  Finally, I acknowledge that every Arizonan has their Mexican food spot. THIS ONE IS MINE.   I love La Fonda like a brother or old friend, that never lets you down. Their chips fill you up before dinner because you eat three bowls of them and basically drink the salsa. Everything on the menu is delicious. Yes, be careful, that plate just came out of the oven and will burn the daylights out of you.   There are always leftovers. The margaritas are on point. The red sauce is Sonoran style. The green is amazing but nobody ever orders it because they're stupid. I love La Fonda.   La Fonda has been there for me, in thick and thin. When I am happy, La Fonda. Sad? La Fonda. Looking for a good margarita? La Fonda. Quiet night out? La Fonda. Need a babysitter? Nana in La Fonda loves babies. She will take our girl to the fish tank and laugh with her. You see, La Fonda is the answer to everything.   Also, native Scottsdalians (or whatever we are called) gravitate here. Want to run into a friend you've known for 30 years? You guessed it! La Fonda!  Come here. It is the best place. It is a Mecca. And one of the last surviving original businesses in this area, even Saba's Western Store just died. Keep La Fonda alive. Our lives depend on it.   I love La Fonda. The End.

ZCXf10F2OY-ue-WqPe2wmQ.text: Such a wonderful little Mexican joint with extremely delicious food and perfectly affordable prices. The quantity of food provided is massive!! I'm so full and have enough leftovers for at least 2 more meals! Loved it!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Combo of taco, enchilada and tostada with rice &amp; beans. Sooo good and sooo much food!!

QLKqbTTBprqBT9K9DUxkmA.text: No frills straight forward good authentic foos. Margarita was great and our waiter super attentive. For a Saturday night, no wait but still a full restaurant.. my enchilada was swimming in cheese but proved delicious. My only future recommendation is pictures on the menu more unique sauces. Overall, you can't go wrong.

qlvlRVdQXGTCQ2ms1BLZHQ.text: This place obviously read the reviews and improved on the negative feed back. And I'm glad I gave it another chance. Now the food comes out nice and Hot! That was the common complaint I saw. And that was what I received the first time eating here. I'm happy to return and keep returning for great Mexican food. Keep up the great food and service! I look forward to returning time and time again!

hXWZbDXOyFsGjO6wJwErBw.text: Authentic? No  Good? Yes The lunch buffet had a lot of options.  Everything was fresh.  The fat lil fish in the tank when you walk in is super happy to see you. I would steal him.....

nhkxuWld80C1_mWbmtPpOQ.text: It was my first time hear and the service was terrible... sat down and it took 20 min before I had to get up and tell someone to help us....  once we ordered it took another 45 minutes to get our food... the worst thing is, a couple sat after us and they got helped right away.  I will never visit this place again.

gk7jsSnBRtbVGrc03GDRZA.text: Consistently good quality and good portions. I have eaten there twice and take out twice (Grub delivery). $6 delivery fee. Worth it if you order over $30, but you also need to tip. I don't know how drivers and the restaurant split those. Menudo is OK, good, not great. Chicken fundido and the burros are great. The chili (red and green) entree portion is large and loaded. Enough for 2 people easily.

6Ha4PQgEzJYCk_RYvq8qAQ.text: My wife and went to LA Fonda Del Sol for a special anniversary dinner that was meaningful to us. The food was excellent as was the service.  Our complaint was not being told there would be a large party of 20 or more directly in back of us taking up the entire wall opposite us. We are certain the management did not know how noisy the group would be. We asked our server if there was another table in a semi private room in front of us. We were told it was for larger parties than 2.  When I returned home I called the manager who said after more tables complained she spoke to the obnoxious party. Too late for us. Our evening was ruined.  Again the food and service here is very good. That was not our complaint.

YPqaBPBgOeOxrrBBTqcyWw.text: When I'm traveling to AZ I'm always on the hunt for good Mexican food. La Fonda Del Sol did not disappoint. We were there on a Monday nite, so it wasn't too busy. We were seated quickly. Almost as we sat down the chips ( warm and fresh) and salsa were served. 2 different salsa, one a little  more spicy than the other, mixed together, it was great.  I ordered the cheese enchilada and tamale combo. These are 2 of my Mexican favorites. My plate was hot, the food was hot and again we didn't wait long for the meals to arrive. My husband ordered the beef burrito and he said it was also very good. The Burrito was pretty big, and neither of us left hungry. We also ordered the Fried Ice Cream, once again it was very good..  We will definitely visit La Fonda Del Sol again.

qY8EzVKZLppQ_G7elhbeFQ.text: I've been a fan of La Fonda Del Sol since my teens, I'm in my 40's now and let me tell ya the place hasn't changed; excellent service, fantastic food, easy to read menu, to-go orders are the way to-go, always ready for pick up, never a disappointment on the receiving end. The first time my co-workers nominated me to call in the order, I felt I may have screwed up on one plate, thanks to Roman for the quick fix. I would definitely reccomend this Mexican food restaurant to friends, family and (of course) co-workers. Duh! *****

3Y7_ukQnNecJgmsN5cgNKQ.text: The food was amazing!!! Chips came out hot- almost too hot to eat, but seems such a rarity anymore to get hot chips, and the salsa to accompany it was amazing! Staff was very friendly, even at the end of the night.  The small nacho plate was actually big enough that two people could've shared it and had enough food.  The corn tamale was amazing!!! I don't know if I've had one that was that delicious and perfect texture- not dried out.  The burrito, despite just being a bean burrito, was huge! But it had a nice creamy taste to the beans (which are vegetarian btw).  Very excited to have found this place! Prices were very reasonable and food was exceptional!!!

xpZOxypB93MCzy9gaeycYg.text: Stumbled upon this little gem when I was with a group for dinner.    The food was really good and it was fresh and flavorable for sure.    The salsa was really good too.     If and when we are back in that area I'd totally go back for dinner.

8QdvmKKLgfGyqgb5IThucQ.text: Nice little restaurant. Old school. Not pretentious at all except for the two middle age "Scottsdale Ladies" with their big hair, sunglasses and hats. Also, at least when we visited, loved that they had ALL MALE WAITORS. Not because they were pretty to look at ( they were) but because guys just kick ass at waiting tables, especially at Mexican restaurants.   And food served on HOT plates.   They nailed it.  We'll be back.

Ld-7u4iqxyCXg29fWaBKHg.text: This has been a favorite spot of mine for over two decades. I had the WORST experience that I've ever had at any restaurant at La Fonda Del Sol. The waiter completely messed up the order and brought all incorrect food and proceeded to hand us a bill for items that we never received.   The manager should have comped our $62 check and instead, had me go through every item that we ordered and received. Not my job...   We had family in from out of town who wanted great Mexican food. We could have gone anywhere and we chose this place unfortunately.   As we were waiting, a cockroach ran across the floor. Disgusting. Never ever EVER will I return to this place.

WEbegm0cCXUrnwEjppOS8A.text: Best Salsa in town , hands down. I could literally drink a vat of this stuff.  Not a gourmet meal, but I've never had a bad one here and I've been coming here 1x per month for the past 20 years.  Carnitas or carne asada  hard shell tacos are my suggestion.

tQK4iiiG2yZjKNVRdwtn4Q.text: Gave this a lot of thought before posting . I've been here 3 times.   I like the food. Price to portion is good value. 4 stars. Nothing is a stand out. Good American-ized Mexican food. Good chips, salsa and hot sauce. They have Fanta!  Service is spotty. 3 to 5 stars.  Dining room is every bit the dive. But it's clean. 5 stars. See "restrooms" below.   Consistent with being a dive, the menu has mis-prints. "Cream cheese." On Mexican food? Probably mean sour cream, I think. Either that or the cream cheese is super sour and soupy!  Restrooms are out of the 1970s. 0 stars. Just avoid them. Probably costs too much to remodel which would force ADA compliance and cut into their dining area.  I imagine this place does just fine without worrying about fixing anything.   Definitely coming back.

QDtpr_8w4fdaN6KjO3q-xA.text: This place puts the "meh" in Mexican. I guess I expected more because it looks like a small, authentic family-run restaurant, but everything we had was fairly bland, and the service fairly lackluster for a Sunday at 11:30. No one seemed to want to be there, and in retrospect neither did we.

3iuNeCPLmydbpouFebKp7w.text: Love, love, love this place !  Food is delish and every time we have visitors I bring them there and they love it too !

hEgJqpQuslnxTr6YmZ9Wrg.text: We were in the mood for some Mexican food and stumbled across this joint. It's a casual dining place with 15 or so tables and a small bar. Complimentary Chips & Salsa are included with your meal. They give you 2 types of Salsa.....Mild and Spicy. yelp.com/biz_photos/HTls... The Spicy Salsa is very good.....the Chips are very thin and break easily....so they got 1/2 of that right. yelp.com/biz_photos/HTls... For dinner we ordered: Cheese Crisp Appetizer - $7.25 yelp.com/biz_photos/HTls... #11 Cheese Enchilada Combo (Enchilada, Beans, Rice) - $11.50 yelp.com/biz_photos/HTls... Carnitas Burrito - $9 yelp.com/biz_photos/HTls... Side of Sour Cream - $1.35 2 Glasses of House Cabernet - $6.75 The Cheese Crisp was very good. It's like an open faced Quesadilla with the Tortilla cooked nice and crispy. The Cheese Enchilada was OK....kind of salty. The Better Half enjoyed her Carnitas Burrito, but she said it wasn't anything special. She only ate 1/2 of it....took the other 1/2 home. The glasses of Wine was hers also....and thought it was ok, what could you expect from house Wine? Overall, it was an OK dinner....did not 'wow' us. Return Factor - 40%

bdpfqbC4pk6ZN-BIwL9gog.text: I love Mexican food, I always test the salsa and chips to see if it will be good. I was not disappointed. And then I found out they have a all you can eat Mexican food buffet that I heard was great, I am going to try that this week. I always have the cheese enchiladas which comes with rice and refried beans they were the best refried beans I ever had. A must place to go for great Mexican food.

70O9bvKENHwDHiM0y4dcXg.text: Large place and quite busy when we arrived, but ample staff provided fast and friendly service.  Great salsa (the fresh, chunky, non-spicy one of the two small carafes bright to the table).  Salsa and tortilla chips seemed infinitely refillable. Shrimp fajitas were delicious. "Checking in" on Yelp got me a free soft drink which was refilled for free as well.  Husband enjoyed large selection of beers to choose from.  Spanish rice was the best I've tasted (I usually have one bite and don't eat any more).  I appreciated the fact that salsa, rice, refried beans and guacamole were not at all spicy; other folks can always add hot sauce!  A great find on our unexpected one night in Scottsdale due to a cancelled flight.

gGiQmZQH8vwtph9bLQl8zg.text: Second visit here and food was just as good. Service was a little slow for Saturday at 3 but was with a larger group so it wasn't as big if a deal.

0EPsMtYNtrCXkYP8jKohqA.text: Absolutely AMAZING FOOD, BEST I'VE EVER HAD. Manager was awesome, service was amazing, had to tip the cook for the fact that we'll it was just awesome, will definitely be back anytime I'm in the area again. TY for the amazing experience.

pNCpgjQx14AJSOj5z-1oDQ.text: Have been coming here since I was my kids age and its still a family favorite.  The food is very good and has been consistent over the years.  We have never ordered anything that we didn't enjoy.   The only thing I noted yesterday was the cheese crisp was 'runny' and not spread or cut evenly...I think it came out too early.  Also they used to bring the hot salsa out in a full container and now only do half; that said, they gladly bring more.  (Chips and salsa are excellent.)  Most of the servers have been there 'forever' and the owners is always around and active.   When we arrived yesterday they weren't busy, so service started out good.   However, in the next half an hour they filled to capacity and they weren't staffed for it, so it was very difficult to get prompt or attentive service from that point forward.  The atmosphere is where they suffer a bit.  The restaurant hasn't been updated in years and their is quite a bit of wear and tear.   But the oddest part, that I noticed today, and then when I read other reviews, is that something about the ventilation system means your clothes end up smelling really strongly of the kitchen.   I don't know what they can do about that without closing down for a significant remodel and none of us locals want that.

a9aeD_kpl2e2figMvCVXzg.text: Me and my boyfriend were referred here by a local Scottsdale resident (since we are from California) we tried it. I actually did not like it at all... which is very rare considering I love Mexican food. I was really disappointed I got an enchilada, tostada, taco combo with rice and beans. The beans and rice had no flavor, and the mild salsa had too much onion. I asked for a shredded beef enchilada and for some reason it had celery in it, I dont like celery at all so I just picked them out. My boyfriend didnt care for it either. The best part of this place was the hot red sauce (not mild) with the chips. The waiters never came to our table and the bathroom was horrible.

_DMrbhlqNHNjKXayQtnD_w.text: This is my first review on Yelp, and decided this to be my first because I feel I wasted a lot of money by reading the other reviews for this restaurant and going there for lunch with my family while vacationing in Scottsdale.  We were looking for good Mexican food and read the reviews on Yelp for La Fonda Del Sol. We went there for lunch yesterday.  My Chimichanga was doughy, and tamale was like cake - very airy masa.  Very unfriendly woman delivered chips and salsa to the table, waiter was very hurried - even though there were very few people in the restaurant - and bathroom was filthy.  You can get better food and service elsewhere.  Do not waste your time and money.

AdMxLwmcIoSlhJwXkfcHXg.text: My favorite Mexican food anywhere, not just in AZ! They have the best chips and salsa and their shredded beef enchiladas and shrimp enchiladas are unbeatable as well!  I'm sure other menu items are equally amazing, but those are so delicious that I can't bring myself to try other things. The service has always been extremely warm and friendly.  Truly a gem!!

Txuhz1fNThdB667sax8pFA.text: Last night I reviewed Sol, hip place with lousy food.  La Fonda is not hip but a culinary delight.  Margaritas are tequila laden lime delights.  Dos Equis served in a frosty mug.  Chips and salsa are delightful and served in non hip bowls.  Topopo is a delectable Mex  version of the Italian chopped salad.  Food is great.  Our favorite restaurant in Scottsdale and the staff has not had any plastic surgery.

xVbDyoGZWl8Z59syw04fIg.text: This place has been in Scottsdale forever and I can tell why. I've been here a few times, each time the staff has been very friendly and accommodating, their salsa is bomb and I recommend the steak fajitas!

y8yTZxO1_cEWHgY5GToUBw.text: Excellent! The best " old school" Mexican food we've found since moving here. The chicken fajitas were delicious.

l2s_18IcbQ_wYhAgInDrkA.text: Just because a place has been there awhile does not mean you will have a good dining experience. Yes, the chips are free and warm, but they are very thin and if you are dipping, most will break in half. Fonda uses that dumb salsa in a jar style which still makes no sense (Give us a bowl of salsa). My main course was a watery, messy disaster and the owner who I will call "mama" could barely defend her chile relleno after I called her out on the nasty food. The coating on the tiny pepper fell off and somehow it looked like my plate got flooded with pepper juice or an unknown liquid, possibly from the watery beans (see pics). Mama did shoot back a comment, but never full stood at our table and chatted after she got a negative response from me over the standard "How is everything" question. Keep serving up that slop mama and believing your Mexican food is good, but the smart diners will go elsewhere for a better experience. If I wanted soup, I would have ordered it mama!

A previous visit was  bit disappointing but this was probably because I came way after the lunch peak at that time. I met Rand H. and Robyn N. here at 11 am this time around, so the food was freshly prepared and plentiful. Three and a half stars, rounded up to 4.

CSNMfYhM-Qio4cK1FF2ryg.text: I don't find myself posting online reviews about restaurants all that much however this place is the exception. First off, best Mexican food I have ever eaten--hands down. The service was top notch, the ambiance had a great non-commercialized feel to it and the prices were very reasonable. If you are on the fence about this place then cast aside your worries and give it a go! You won't regret it!

rWJh96xiJr3OyweLUG6PXQ.text: I really enjoyed this place.  It is like a diner inside, seating and such... the food is wonderful.  I love the salsa containers...cute.  The food was great, plenty of it too!  I had a full meal and my husband had only a taco.  We shared the rice and beans I got, and we were both stuffed!  Margarita was great and his beer was icy cold and great too!

N97JzzPJVfdyLhHyZi3YDg.text: Awesome homemade Mexican this place is a must would I highly recommend the fajitas!!!

rotz3RRgxpsWWNLy-N0JEg.text: Breakfast was great! Some of the best chorizo con huevo I've had in the valley.   Salsa was good and spicy!

x-549QZLHrfTP6Sa3cPZqw.text: What else is there to say but that LaFonda is one of the best Mexican restaurants in Scottsdale / Phoenix.  The service is friendly and punctual and you cannot go wrong regardless of the meal. If you're snobsdale type person, the ambiance may not be your speed - for all others embrace and enjoy.  In the end, the line out the door waiting for a table tells the story.  Highly recommend the Especial Fundido Burro. Normally this comes with chicken, but if you ask nicely they will fill it with ground beef.  It is a True cornucopia of delight..  Best nights with no waiting - Tuesday - Thursday.  Friday and Saturday always seem busy at dinner time.

IU6vMDtjvfe0GV58Bz8frw.text: I grew up in Southern California where traditional Mexican food can be found just about anywhere. I have lived in Phoenix for about 8 years now, 5 years in Scottsdale and I'm sad it took me this long to find this place! La Fonda Del Sol hit the spot!! Traditional Mexican food, some may call it "old school" with all the flavor I loved from the Mexican restaurants back in CA!   Chips come out hot- served with 2 types of salsa which were both delicious. I ordered the shredded beef taco and cheese enchilada combination. The beef taco was just delicious. They fry up the taco shell which makes it even more authentic. Red sauce on enchilada was very flavorful. Rice and beans were very good. Beans were thicker and very good! My dad got the shredded beef taco and cheese Chile relleno and he enjoyed both very much. Green sauce with the Chile relleno was really yummy!   Margaritas and staff were also great! Would highly recommend if you're looking for traditional Mexican food in a traditional Mexican restaurant setting. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 10. Taco and Enchilada

gO3WC8OeBzSbWkjlR9rt2Q.text: Such a gem! Sat at the bar to watch a basketball game and Zach took good care of us.   This place is great for celiacs as everything except for the flour tortillas are gluten free! Highly recommend!!

nnHItOgrxejB_PRq4WEn6g.text: This hit the spot for have good Mexican food with rice and beans. The dinner platter options are plenty. Service was friendly and gave good suggestions. Our waiter suggested the carne asada and the fajitas.   The Carne Asada dinner combo was actually very good - definitely a must get! I opted for a combination of chile relleno, beef tamale, cheese enchilada...everything had cheese all over it. I didn't care for the tamale honestly but everything else was solid.  this place is super casual, local diner joint. They seem to have regular customers. They do serve complementary chips and 2 kinds of salsa

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 5. Del Sol Combination
Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 20. Carne Asada must get

6bM3LCTmoI6tg0F42pGVXQ.text: LOVED IT! Tonight we were visiting family in Scottsdale and decided to get some dinner.  We happened to be driving by La Fonda and decided to check it out. It doesn't look like much from outside, but right away we were greeted and seated. The location is a bit small, but looks so much larger once inside. The menu was pretty great and I knew almost instantly what I was having. Chips and salsa were brought out and my only complaint was I hate that they put the salsa in little jars . I'm not a fan of having to dump it on to a plate and try to pick it up on your chips. But that's my opinion and didn't take away any from the great food and service. The chips came out still warm and tasty. I decided to try something new and ordered the Del Sol Combination which came with rice and beans, Sour Cream Enchilada, Chicken Flauta ,And Cheese Chili Relleno. I ate every single bite! My husband had fajitas and loved them. He said the refried beans were really good. The guacamole on my flauta was so good. I wish I had more. Everything was priced very well for the large portions. Can't wait to visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. So good!
Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Del Sol Combo

YL3rHgg3LZ1zCylebIR06A.text: I so fell in love with the food at LA FONDA DEL SOL. Definitely a locals spot, off the strip and away from Old Town - La Fonda served up delicious and hearty portions. Everything I had in a three item combo was delicious! Enchiladas, tacos, chili releno all outstanding.  I go to Scottsdale every March, and I will definitely return. 5 stars!!!!

Z-iHqP3mdeAhX-ELF4siyg.text: Authentic Mexican restaurant with the best Mexican food I've ever had! I am a California resident and this place has Southern California Mexican restaurants beat by far!   First, the chips come out super hot with two choices of salsa. I like mild salsa and ooooo weeee it was probably the best salsa I've had as well. It has a ton of flavor and tastes incredibly fresh.   We ordered the beef tacos al la carte in photo, the lunch special G (no pic sorry!) beef taco and cheese enchilada- it was impeccable!, and I had the lunch special E I believe. It was the burro with red or green sauce and comes with rice and beans. I had mine with shredded chicken and I wanted to try both the red and green sauce. So I got it half and half :D. The red sauce had a stronger flavor which was really good. The green was good too, next time I'll get it all red. The chicken was so moist and tender and had really good flavor! The tortilla was so soft and enjoyable. This place is honestly so good!   Tried a bite of my bros beef tacos and they were the best as well! Crispy crispy shells with very tender shredded beef. Truly authentic and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Burro with half red and half green sauce w/rice n beans :D
Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beef tacos al la carte

RqqvYT-JottYUhYZcrerKw.text: Had a craving for authentic traditional mexican food, so we decided to try this spot. Fresh chips were served hot with both a mild and a spicier salsa. The lunch specials were a full plate's worth with beans and rice included. Would definitely come eat here again!

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork burro &#34;enchilada&#34; style with red enchilada sauce.

Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Burro &#34;enchilada&#34; style with green chili.

GFr8nXtKMj-VY4_dSUET6w.text: Maybe it's because I grew up in Southern California or maybe I'm just a snob about Mexican food, but I am in a perpetual state of searching for a great Mexican restaurant in Scottsdale/East Phoenix and Tempe. That is why I decided to drive up to this part of Scottsdale to try La Fonda Del Sol.  Walking in (from the rear entrance) you see a setup for a buffet and tons of photos of famous people on the walls, didn't know what to make of all this. We were greeted and seated and immediately upon sitting down we met with a ton of noise. I don't know if it's the narrowness of the restaurant or the walls but this place gets super loud - to the point of annoyance.  My buddy and I ordered some food, it was okay - it wasn't awful but wasn't food that I'd have to make the trek up to this part of Scottsdale to eat again. Our server was attentive and nice, but overall given how loud this place gets and the food being just okay I do not foresee returning here again.  If I was to give it a rating based on distance I would say this: if are further than 3 miles from this place I wouldn't make the drive to check it out.  The search for mindblowing Mexican food in this part of Phoenix Metro continues! (If any of you  fellow Yelpers reading this have a recommendation for me please shoot me a message).

DCIc036tvJdEXs5ekrTCmA.text: La Fonda Del Sol is the perfect Mexican restaurant. It has everything I have ever looked for in a Mexican restaurant. Absolutely amazing food and great service where the waiter is super helpful.  We started with the complimentary chips and salsa. The chips actually came out super warm and in a huge basket. They were nice and thick and crispy. They bring you two kinds of salsa, one hot and one medium. Both were great.  Cadillac Margarita ($11.95 large) - Once we heard they had a margarita made with Patron we decided we had to try it. We ordered one to share and the waiter mentioned we could get a large for only $2 more. Why not! This margarita was really nice and strong, not for those who like super sweet margaritas. 4/5  Supreme Nachos with Chicken ($8.95) - I was going to get the large nachos and the waiter suggested I go for the small, since the large apparently feeds 2-3 people. All I can say is THANK GOD he did because the small size was massive and I couldn't even finish that! These nachos were the nachos I dream about getting every time I order nachos when I eat out and am usually disappointed. They were absolutely covered in cheese and there was no chip without something on it. The beans were mixed in to the cheese to create an amazing gooey spread. It also came with chicken and scoops of guacamole and sour cream. Honestly, these were in the top 3 best nachos I've ever had. And if you know me, you know how much I love nachos. I would highly recommend. 5/5  Fajita Burrito Dinner ($15.95) - The husband ordered a chicken fajita burrito and the waiter mentioned that if he wanted rice and beans on the side, he could get the Shrimp Fajita Burrito Dinner and get chicken instead of shrimp. Does this waiter read minds?? That was exactly what my husband had wanted and he was so happy to get that. As soon as he bit into this burrito his eyes lit up and he said "oh my god this is the best burrito I've ever had". I was like yea yea let me eat my amazing nachos. But finally I got curious at his enthusiasm and asked for a bite of chicken. HOLY CRAP. This was the most flavorful, juiciest, grilled chicken I have ever had in my life. It was the most delicious thing I've ever tasted. After that bite I was so jealous and wanted that dish for myself! 5/5  I am so sad we don't live in Arizona because I would literally eat here once a week. And if we ever come back, I am running to eat here again.

cLh0EF-9aMIyQ1xOtaygng.text: Yum! I am picky about my salsa and this place has fresh and delicious mild and spicy salsa. We happened to stop here after shopping nearby because the place smelled so delicious! I had a perfectly proportioned bean and cheese burrito and my little one had the taco kids meal. Both were enormous and I loved the fresh lettuce and tomatoes that came with the rice and beans. They were super nice. And they seemed to have several to-go orders while I was there.

l2A122OBHE9-MbZIGpo41Q.text: We had a very large group and they placed us in basically a long hall which really amplified the noise. With us and the other patrons, it made it very hard to hear. Food was good and price was reasonable.

yqqVERACKash41wKLl38sw.text: Want decent menudo? Fonda del Sol has it!  Seriously.  The food is good. Not the best like I've had in EL Paso Tx/Juarez Mex. But decent..  Hubby loves the Manchacha burrito.

ZhqsaU1WBEgL37fmUYMPxA.text: Stayed at a hotel close by. Found the place on yelp and had good reviews. Looks like a family run restaurant, small homey. The food was good, I had the carne machca. The only down side was the salsa was not hot.   I will definitely will be back

q-Iuh6JY7JNfvzBjfBdwxA.text: When we walked in we were seated very quickly with a friendly face every server was very nice all seem to very happy and they were all very quick The gentleman got our drinks quickly and our food quickly to us as well we ordered a red burrito with rice and beans and the rice and beans was the best they've ever had a red burrito was very good the meet was very tender we also ordered a beef Tamale which was very good and salsa and chips were very fresh all have no complaints would eat here again
