hyZ0m3tCgJ3icXH2XYWt9Q.text: No for me. I cant stomach Tex-Mex (cheddar & lettuce on tacos). Place is a dive. So many much better places to dine in Scottsdale. This place is for the Taco Bell crowd

CRob8K9AECNbVecFXsm4WA.text: I don't understand how this is even considered a Mexican restaurant, when they serve Velveeta cheese as queso .... I should leave it at that, but I won't. A coworker and I came here for lunch the other day, so excited, but were quickly let down and promptly left the premises hungry and annoyed. You can finish subpar food, but bad food you leave on the plate, pay the bill and leave.   The best thing we ate was the complimentary chips and salsa. I ordered one chicken tamale and one beef tamale, now what I received was NOT a tamale! Each "tamale" was smothered in sauce and cheese, I had no problem with that, but once you got to the actual "tamale" it was corn masa MUSH! A deconstructed tamale ... so I was really served corn mush with sauce and cheese.   My coworker ordered the beef supreme nachos with queso. He received a plate of tortilla chips with unseasoned beef, topped with straight Velveeta cheese.   Overall we were more than disappointed.

xFv2ONgfWfVM0kulSsy6UQ.text: I came to Phoenix with one goal for food in mind...to find delicious Mexican food. To find a place that could rival our favorite restaurant in Los Angeles.   Staying nearby and this place popped up Yelp. In the past I've spent over an hour on Yelp before deciding, but when I saw the pictures of the food from here, the style of the menu, the decor of the restaurant itself, my search was over in a minute. *Wife was happy*  Expectations were not high, but when we sat down to order my wife told me, "I've never seen you get this excited for food before." We've been together for 4 years. I had a good feeling, and I was really excited to try it. I can't remember the last time I've had this feeling for food.   Bridget was our waitress and she was amazing. I ordered a cheese enchilada and chicken hard shell taco with rice and beans, just like at our spot back home. Chips and salsa came out quickly and the chips were so hot...perfect. Our place doesn't serve chips and salsa like this, you have to pay extra and go to the salsa bar with tiny plastic cups. So this was HUGE for us. It's what's expected.   Food came piping HOT, on a plate that was just as hot. Our place serves warm food on reusable plastic type plates with disposable plasticware. We're okay with it, but this place wins. Love getting food on a super hot plate. The food looked amazing.   I dug in and it was delicious. Okay let me tell you, the cheese enchilada was perfect. That red sauce with the yellow and white cheese...hmm, I could eat these until I'd burst and I'd die a happy man. The chicken tacos was solid, it felt homemade. I thought my grandma was back there making it.  Our place back home serves "authentic Mexican food", but I honestly don't know from which area or state. I was told the food here was Sonoran style. So I can't compare it side by side, but it obviously gets a 5 star from me, and if I were a local this WOULD be my favorite restaurant. I mean it just made my trip. It reminded me of my grandmas cooking, which I haven't had in 25 years. Lol it was spiritual eating here for me.   Although I ate a lot, I didn't feel too full, and I had to try something sweet. Our place has dessert, but I never get it because the portions are bigger, and we rarely eat in because there aren't enough tables to sit. Probably half the size of this place. The fried ice cream was AMAZING! I'm so glad I tried it.   I know people like different types of Mexican food, but all I can say is trust the pictures. If it looks like something you'd like, than go try it out and hopefully you love it too.   Told the wife that we're coming back a couple more times before going back home.

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yes! Trust the pics...and the high ratings. Chicken taco and cheese enchilada with rice and beans.

gw46z1mcIJ8CLHAytgNHkA.text: Good old fashion Mexican food. Service is great and margaritas are amazing ! lChris is the best waiter but all are good..

nmcZ3_oDSDjkaJ_zs-6JAA.text: After my previous review where I said the prices are too high for this type of food, the owner replied in a very nice way explaining that he had to raise his prices due to minimum wage increases.  As former restaurant owners, we sympathize. We have returned many times since.  I would say we eat here about once a month.  We usually go in the afternoon, and usually have the same pleasant waiter.   We love the chips and salsa.   My husband's go to meal is two cheese enchiladas, a la carte, with onions added.  The enchiladas are very good, with the cheese melted on the edges to an almost crisp consistency.  Yummy.   The cheese chili relleno is also very good.   We've had some other dishes which are average in taste. The happy hour margaritas are tasty. This is our go to Mexican restaurant, usually during Happy Hour.  If you get Happy Hour drinks and a la carte menu items, the prices are reasonable.

3O_HbFI49GQftgyq4tnb1w.text: In love!  Cheese crisp is old school divine!  I did easy cheese and it was perfect. The 2 salsas at the table were a perfect blend of spicy and that great chunkier homemade salsa. I am in love with this place!  I like old school but need it to be good and not too sauce/cheese heavy handed. And, my waiter Andrew has obviously been here a while-which I like. Tells me he believes in this place. Finished my order with sour cream beef enchilada. There were chunks  of been in it. Seriously, love this place. Thank you Yelp for not steering me wrong.

CpyHYBHu_4hhUex3ztNHnQ.text: I hate to have to do this but the last several of our visits have been lackluster. The food quality seems to have declined and the service has too. Last time we were in they had one woman seating, taking orders, bringing the food, refilling drinks, cleaning the tables and checking people out - needless to say it was a slow go. A few years ago we loved this place and now we are on the fence.....

c_ERPwh26VAamLl1CEWHBg.text: I used to come here all the time a few years ago and then I slowly forgot about it as I got into a new relationship. We decided to pick up takeout because I was craving Mexican. Oh boy, I'm so glad because it's so good! Yes, I'm eating as I'm writing this. I remembered how I always mixed the hot salsa with the mild to get the perfect salsa and they sell pitchers of margaritas! My boyfriend enjoyed his meal, so we're definitely coming back. He even said he'll bring his friends. It's one of my favorite hole-in-the-wall joints! Oh, by the way... I'm eating the chicken fundido! :)

oAR3gLN2PlxsXt3y50ZBRA.text: I enjoyed my Chicken Fundido.  It don't care for celerey that was in it, but other than that it was good.  I also liked the beans and rice that came with it.  My picky friend who never eats beans said he thought they were good.  The salsa was a little heavy on the onions for my taste and quite mild, but mixing it with the hotter sauce made it better.  The waiter took good care of us and I have nothing to complain about there. The chips were still hot when they got to our table.  I don't see that every day.   I will go back there again.

CfsI8kGMYJRPRwfT_e7v8Q.text: Authentic, very tasty, reasonably priced, you would think your in Mexico. I will be back...

lCcHKOiW9aNNqys6-uP76A.text: I got take out and it was overwhelming awesome! I got free chips and three salsas, guacamole, sour cream, and pick de gallo included with no charge and the shrimp and steak fajitas were just delicious! I'm definitely getting this again.

WnmTAxHic1lRJcGUNVO34g.text: This place is awesome! It looks like its been around for years, and the food is pretty good. Its hard to find good mexican food in Scottsdale. I am from Texas and let me tell you, thats where some good mexican food is at. However, La Fonda is pretty good too (not comparable) but good.   Our group ordered a bunch of stuff, among which was the machaca burro, bean and cheese (boring but good!), green corn tamale, and enchiladas. Everything was great, a little much on the cheese but all in all I would keep coming back!   Oh! best part! 2.75 for a pint of Shock Top? Whaaat? Its not even happy hour. We got a pitcher. The glasses were frozen as was the pitcher which was cool. They didn't have oranges for some of our party though, but the server was really nice and got some from the kitchen.  Prices range from about 10-15 per ontray and drinks are reasonably priced! Check this place out!! I've lived in Scottsdale for years and can't believe I just went now.   PS Regular salsa is not that good :/ Chips are!

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Random fish tank

6IvlFbhc2AZRjzelClIdcw.text: This is my go to spot as a late night eatery. They really aren't that many places in Phoenix they're open 24 /7 that you can get a decent meal.  The many tacos are delicious and the seafood quesadilla could feed an entire family. I'm never had a bad meal here and considering the options around the area it's always a reasonably priced and delicious choice.

74LM77ygyrC3eNEa-Duz_Q.text: We arrived at 11 am just as they were putting out the fresh hot buffet. The buffet is absolutely amazing and delish and as always the service is prompt and friendly

MhyKpvbuxT3mREHL6Yfn8g.text: Had a green chili burrito enchilada style, beef taco, rice and beans.  Pretty authentic for the most part, could use a little more seasoning but flavor was pretty good.  The price IS a little high, in my opinion and the salsa is fresh but lacking in seasoning.  Staff friendly and attentive.

AqBOvQ6U6yZiO2YGrsgcsA.text: Great food.  Good service. Salsa is the best.  Enchiladas are very good.  I don't know what they put in the sauce, but damn is it good!  No better Mexican food anywhere in Scottsdale.

yypxHWidfjDMf2greoKwpQ.text: I've been eating here for years, enjoying the food and the service. This restaurant has always served good family style Mexican dishes. However recently, there has been a change in the quality of the food and service. I'm not sure if management/ownership has changed, but the restaurant isn't as clean or well organized as on previous visits.   The prices have changed, and several of the increases were rather steep considering the lower quality ingredients being served. The beef dishes are prepared with tougher cuts of meat and the results are very dry and tasteless.  This is especially True with the steak fajitas.  There is a lack of consistency in both the food preparation and the service. The Chimichangas are not always hot and crisp,  if sent back to the kitchen the plate is returned hotter but soggy. The salad greens are not properly dried, and there is a pool of water in the bottom of the dish. The whole beans are frequently under cooked, and unseasoned.    If you want great service, ask for Bridgette. She is fast, friendly, and will follow up with drink refills, extra napkins, and clearing off empty dishes. She is always polite and courteous. If you come in once, she will remember you on your next visit. I cannot say this about the other servers.   One server spends her time hanging on the male patrons especially those at the bar. I find this same server very rude especially on the phone. On one occasion my takeout order was completely messed up. I called to point this out and she was short and angry with me. I was told to bring the order back. She wasn't concerned that the kitchen/server had made an error, or that I would have to make another round trip to fix their mess. I would have complained to the manager/owner, but they are not on the premises.    I think the restaurant needs an experienced manager to clean up the restaurant, procure better quality ingredients, and train the serving staff. I would love to see the original La Fonda Del Sol once again.

U0BTuMnrHVAACDwGMTZRsQ.text: I love this hidden gem. You would never know from the exterior what lies beneath. Definitely worth a stop, but don't take a seat at the bar. That poor thing is sad looking.

BikJ5dS--bQhoFrzNHZ3Pw.text: Awesome.  Chips and salsa best I've ever had.  Enchiladas were amazing and authentic.  Mole sauce was perfect.  Kids loved their bean burritos.  Hole in the wall place but just gave it an authentic look. Prices were about $15 for a huge plate of food.

2A7AgxB0phzWtAB5KRkd0g.text: Have been here several times and they are consistent with a couple of things. First off the chips and salsa rock! The hot salsa is very tasty and the chips are usually hot and fresh. The taco plate is always a winner. And the service usual is usually iffy. It's good 50% of the time. For the food that you get the price is very reasonable. I will def go back, even if it's just for the chips and salsa, since after all that's what good Mexican food is all about!! (stay away from the older woman/manager...she is RUDE!! and don't even TRY to use a restaurant.com gift certificate..she will cut you! lol)

wPVFWOa6SMlUCc_swFqnkg.text: Great food. This is friendly restaurant with a staff that is happy to place an order for you even if it's right before they close.

8FJ58MK5O8-2OLAFnR4rWw.text: This place is a great little hole in the way - while the food was good (not the best), BUT the service is why it gets the three stars. The place got busy but so does every other restaurant on a Saturday night and their servers just couldn't hang. I would only come back if it's an off hour of the day.

FpO_Wv6g9v3rK1_nKtmEyA.text: This place has been here for a very long time. They do a decent job but in the last couple years I have thought they have lost some of the quality of the food as well as the service. Many other Mexican places to choose from in the neighborhood.

udL-WtEp9ERrcmGs-hHkdg.text: This place used to be great but not sure what happened in just the last year.. you're better off going to macayos

wR6K2e9vgrI226ahgavjJw.text: Great place for lunch. Mixed the two salsas too and it made a great combination. Plenty to eat and service was prompt.

5oSsiBjTOHk3xKr3F1q9Lg.text: This place has terrific Mexican food and their salsa is fabulous! My only complaint is that on our most recent visit we were waiting in the tiny bar area for what felt like an eternity and the woman would not make us drinks! It was odd. Once we were seated our server was awesome and told us about some cool local bars.

G5EanqFFXoQtXleZbeA-CQ.text: After a tiring 9-hour drive from CA to AZ, we decided to dine at La Fonda del Sol as it was convenient to our hotel.  We hoped for a peaceful, relaxing atmosphere but were unlucky.  The noise volume here is extremely loud.  Looking around the narrow, booth-lined, almost full dining room, we did not spot any rowdy teens nor partying adults so it was simply general conversation. My wife ordered a chili relleno and chicken taquito; I had a shredded beef taco and a bean tostada while we both went for cheese enchiladas.  The food was served on extremely hot plates (watch your fingers!) with beans and rice but it seemed everything ran together.  We agreed that the cheese enchiladas were good but the chicken was very dry as was  the beef. My wife said she's had much better tasting chilli rellenos.  Chips and salsa came before the entrees;  chips are thin and crispy but rather dry-tasting.  Our server was efficient and very pleasant so earned the third star.

cy3MQuWpDGhcTuTK2SftRA.text: This is the best place ever. Hands down. BEST salsa I've ever had and everything I've had is so incredibly good. Chimichanga's, Fajita's, and Enchilada's! You cannot go wrong. I'd give 10 stars if I could!

kSAQ9uxEe7_8KJOwoIiVBg.text: I have never left a review as quick as this. I ordered from here for the first time through GrubHub & couldn't be more disappointed. It was late. It was cold. It was missing items and 1 of the items I did receive was inedible. It was extremely overpriced as well. They charged me $3 for the smallest thing of guacamole and $4.50 for a fish taco that had nothing special about it and was plain. I will never order from here again and was so bummed because of other reviews which had me excited to try it

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This was what I received and as you can see, it was a disaster and overpriced.

waX5H2pdV8HgC7uFH4fI_w.text: LOVE the food here!!!!  The queso comes with the most amazing crisps!!!!    Fantastic service and people. The food no matter what you order always comes out tasting outstanding. If you are in the mood for quality food, great people, and a fun local scottsdale spot this is your place.

ZHLeypr3bWVac7j_SqLs5Q.text: Awesome small family owned Mexican restaurant in Scottsdale! If your looking for amazing Mexican food with great service give this place a shot, you will not be disappointed!

LJi1SnhZleuUcx5zxI47XA.text: We just stopped for dessert...and the fried ice cream was excellent.  From reading reviews, and what I have heard from long timers, and the many people coming in for dinner, the food is excellent.  However, the dining area is definitely the "dive" that someone else described in their rating.  I think if the owner updated/refreshed the interior, they would have a gold mine.

UGDiyDRJEi0I3j3qXfFqow.text: I have been coming to La Fonda for decades. It was good in the beginning and has been consistently a good experience during that entire time.  The service is super friendly and efficient.  The food is good, starting with the fresh chips and salsa.  The margaritas seem especially tasty after a hard day at work.  I have had several of the entrees, and they are all good.  However, I have a confession to make:  I can't stop ordering the tapopo salad.  It is so good with the marinated chicken, fresh avocado, leafy greens, cheese, etc.  The topping is the simple but delicious oil and vinegar dressing.

XcVciCoj1k1eZ1podCmMSw.text: Very popular local restaurant. The food and chips were surprisingly warm and hot. This is a delightful small cafe in a very busy part of town. If you are in a hurry it is nice to have the buffet  as an option.

8iwQljs0XHqJiX8f0IceZQ.text: We had two chicken chimichangas.  They were huge and absolutely delicious!  The salsa and chips were fresh and delicious!  Great place!

m8LF7c1gEOowUchXWCvGHA.text: We are here weekly, favorites are tacos, tostadas, burros and flautas.  Red and green Chile are both good.  Give the soups a try too.  Like I said, we eat here weekly to get our mex fix.

c1xvJcLQ_1Ue2tr-bBAS_A.text: Great Mexican food. Prices are fair and the food is consistently amazing. This place is always packed, but seems to have just one more table for us to sit as soon as we walk in, and great, fast service.

_rGVQPANR8wQorCWpU2MbQ.text: Awesome lunch buffet. Food is really good. Service is just as good. The chimichanga is gigantic. One of the best places in that area.

WVd4NMsqZ0TO-GVMjmm4iA.text: Bridget was absolutely amazing! Outstanding service and amazing food. Definitely coming back!

SBrEjX7Eg4WXgvc220Fwgw.text: The server Chris was so nice and helpful. He recommended the fajitas. They were absolutely fantastic. Excellent prices too.

0G4BeU3IjODD-4dh72OlyQ.text: The service was excellent but the food was terrible! And overpriced!! Possibly the worst mexican food I have ever eaten. We ordered a beef taco, a beef flauta, a chimichanga meal and guacamole. The guac was decent but very tiny portion. All the meats tasted like they were just boiled in water, completely flavourless. Cannot recommend this place to anyone.

7OcaS0bpTt1rI15urUbISA.text: My favorite Mexican restaurant in Phoenix area.  Not fancy, just great traditional Mexican fare from friendly servers and management at very fair prices. You can tell the cooks have been there forever as the food is very consistent, always timely and served hot.  Nothing like the big chains steam table food. Just go

jHM7UQiAdjXm4gPRzVrSIg.text: This place is not far from our home yet we had never been. We were hungry for Mexican food and the yelp reviews weren't bad so we gave it a try.  They were busy on Friday night but we were seated quickly. Our server (failed to get her name) was terrific. She helped us navigate the menu in terms of what were big sellers and her personal favorites. She put warm chips and fresh salsa on the table. The salsas were fresh and good.  Portions were large and they were very accommodating for a special order from my son (hold the tomatoes, hold the onions). I ordered a guacamole tostada and a bean burrito served enchilada style. It was way too much food. Apparently they have a buffet at lunch time and I'd like to try it as I have three sons who scarf most meals these days.  We'll go back - sorry I hadn't tried it earlier.

3fwDv4LhtLn9hmCa4Bk2XA.text: The food was not good. We ordered tacos to go. Though we ordered the same item some came with soft and some hard tortilla...weird. No good flavors or textures. Skip this place!

rPSaXOBWenyDeT4P7k5ugA.text: The service was good and they were able to seat a larger group pretty easily. Chips and salsa are great, just try not to fill up on them. The food was good and the chimichanga I had was great. Carnitas are large chunks of well seasoned and cooked pork! I loved it. No one was raving about their dishes but all seemed to like them. I would go hear again if I were in that area.

uLcXyq9VTK0c1S9Ffa7_cA.text: NEVER AGAIN. We went in on a Friday afternoon at 130pm. We sat down right away. Ordered 2 ice teas and a beer. After about 7 minutes we ordered 3 tacos. That's it. 3 tables were sat, ordered and were given their food after we ordered. Servers passed us over and over without a word. After 20 minutes we got up and said we wanted to cancel our order and pay for our drinks. Miguel took our order and apparently completely forgot to put it in. No one apologized or even said anything, they printed our check and walked away. ATTENTION OWNERSHIP.... is this how you run your restaurant??? Both of us are in the industry and know good and bad service. Needless to say we won't be back. There are plenty of other places. It's too bad our family was coming in town in 2 days and we WERE going to bring them here. I will make sure to tell EVERYONE how we were treated at La Fonda Del Sole.

CEHLTcFeryIj-VxAiwQjjA.text: Food is bomb.  Love the small town feel.  Great service.  Love the fajitas and chips and salsa.  Drinks are good too.

gbXKgfSN6NbgrLNergxxpA.text: La Fonda has fantastic service and the drinks are as cool as the other side of the pillow. Would recommend this place to everyone.

x_4WzmsenqlGWJ717zL1Hg.text: My Son absolutely loves this place and he describes as his favorite Resteraunt. Enjoyed  for at least ten years and one year he insisted on having his birthday dinner at La Fonda. The staff use to tease him about getting a job when he turned sixteen. We moved away last year and it has been that long since we visited. Went for the buffet and as usual my Son gave it five stars. I love the soft tacos and he loves the buffet. The buffet is huge and for Approx $9.00 you get all you can eat. For a growing boy this is the bomb!  I love the Margaritas as well. Always clean and very polite. It's your neighborhood Resteraunt and the same people have worked in the establishment for years!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Fonda Del Sol - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nice decor

Kmj5PQJrPqZddktcE4KoCg.text: I got street tacos ordered from ubereats and they were good-fresh tortilla, good salsa, and meat was ok, but very small for the price. I was a bit disappointed with the size.

tRD6mDe1vJCtY21P1A-imA.text: Some of the best Mexican food around! Their chicken quesadilla is TO DIE FOR. Service could be better, but the amazing food makes up for it!

Fa9sqFJfu9zgF-b7BOzVvg.text: This is quite possibly my favorite restaurant in Phoenix.  My boyfriend and I frequently visit Phoenix and usually try a new restaurant every time. After eating here on our last trip to PHX we decided we had to come ever single time now. I got the"mini sampler plate". It was a perfect amount of everything (tamale, tostada, taco and cheese enchilada). All of it was excellent. My boyfriend got the nachos,we could not believe the amount of food that it was!  Our server was very attentive, and the atmosphere is excellent.  Overall a very nice Mexican Restaurant!

oyP5DrQQW8epgzagkwRnuQ.text: Great salsa.  Solid service.  Love the location and space.  The shredded beef tamale and taco were delicious.

MF8QkpO1fk0Au6avwMjLHQ.text: I liked our meal at La Fonda Del Sol.  Two kinds of salsa, fresh chips, and really good food.  For comparison, I got the Flamingo Dinner and my wife got the Shredded Beef Chimichanga.  The difference is rice and beans, and even though the rice and beans were good, I don't think it was worth the extra money.  Does this mean that the full plate should be cheaper or the chimi should be $1 more?  I don't know, I guess it depends what the competition is charging.  Although the food was good and the service was friendly, we got there around 8:30 PM on a Saturday night and the place needed a really good cleaning.  I was kicking plastic drink lids and other refuse that was under my table, so I think the place needs to be swept a bit more frequently.  I was also a little surprised at how quiet it was in there because some other businesses seemed to be busier.  But that's okay, we had a good meal and I would go back if I lived in the area.

XKFBEHf4k68cfKHQgNcq-Q.text: This restaurant is one of my favorite little hole in the walls.  Staff is friendly and the salsa is amazing.

TTgKq_GE0YBwX6YLbc-QQg.text: I literally just called this restaurant to see if they had a truck. The lady that answered the phone proceeded, in a rude tone I might add, to say "no,no,no" before I could even finish my sentence. As I was formulating my follow up question, she hung up! I was looking to have them cater for an office event for over 300 people, but based on that first impression I would rather give money to an establishment that values GOOD customer service.  After the above review was posted the owner reached out to me directly and was apologetic. I truly appreciate him taking the time to reach out me. Andrew you're awesome!!!

N3ol17K4mO8z7bemF1NjrA.text: Got a chimmy from here for lunch it was really great I would recommend this place to anyone that's in the hood. Chips came out super hot which was great salsa they bring to your table was really good and the food was ready really fast what more do you want. If it was dinner I would have gotten a margarita but had to be back at work.

1vUTJxS7DtUQ_2fFGDoVvA.text: Terrible service at the host stand. Waited ten minutes before stopping someone to put in our name. We were told we would have the next table. Left after waiting 30 more minutes. Never got seated.

Y22Jj4y_ZZqJhA-hehqQZQ.text: We ended up in the neighborhood on a weekday (lunch time) and we stopped by La Fonda del Sol. We went for the buffet, and what a nice surprise!  They had me at 'menudo and cocido' : ) I must not be very picky for menudo anymore, I thought the menudo and the buffet itself were pretty decent. There are not many options for dishes but they had a very good selection, and options for many ways of eating. I think vegetarians can enjoy rice, beans, chile relleno and enchiladas. They had chicken and beef fajita (hubby liked the chicken better, said beef was a little tough, but you would not expect the best meat on a reasonably priced buffet...). They also had shredded meat and ground beef. Plus some chicken in red chile sauce that was very good too. I was not so fond of the chips this time, I remember them lighter and these ones were more like 'tostitos'... Service was nice and friendly, I did not get the name of the young lady that served us. Overall, great experience and hope to be back for my 'menudo fix'  Menudo - very good ratio of meat to hominy. Cocido, big chunks of meat, too lean for my taste, but at least good amount of meat.

iFPUXq_wyaxAtyZQMS_BeA.text: Wow - we seriously loved this place.  We were just in town for the day and stopped in here.  I had the veggie fajitas and they were loaded with delicious veggies and a full boat of sides (rice beans guac sour cream cilantro etc).  My colleague had the enchiladas and loved them.  The waitress was great.  Would definitely return!!

0foNtRDWG9K1ge1rnoSghw.text: Oreganos was full so we meandered over here. I ordered the large taco salad which came in a small bowl and was half water. It looked like bag salad covered in cafeteria junk. My kids pizzas were super mini Tostinos pizza pockets out of a box. Overall, the average age of customers was around 80 ... and mostly because they have probably all lost their taste buds.

-XMah9JrrQtEW-P-sEYNmw.text: My favorite local Mexican food!!!   Ask to sit at one of Bridget's tables. She is the best waitress in all of Scottsdale.

0ZnZdl71CAE8l_jsnq6Fkw.text: The four of us came for the Buffett Lunch today and the food was generally good. It was nice to finally meet, Rand H who organized and hosted the lunch, along with fellow Yelp'ers Robyn N and Arlin B.  We met around 11:00, as the place was just opening.  I've have taken several photos of the buffet area. Its on the left as you just come in, near the bar.  The selections were pretty wide, including two types of soup. Everything was hot, as you would imagine it should be.  Buffets can be a difficult business.  You have to constantly gauge which items are being consumed the most and prepare the kitchen accordingly. For the most part, I believe La Fonda got it right and stayed on top of things.  As for the food, it was somewhat basic. But as they say in Yelp-ese, it was A-OK.   The Chicken and Steak Fajitas, the cooked Ground Beef, the Shredded Pork, Cheese  Enchiladas and Chili Rellenos were all good, though not memorable. Our table agreed the cooked chicken breast was the weakest and brought down most of our ratings.  The tab, with a soft drink ran $11.93 before tip, but including taxes.

R2t7o-_8mGjtKxmSgjX0yw.text: This is one of our most favorite local Mexican restaurants. I don't think you will be disappointed in anything that you order! We have gone there with many family and friends and everyone is impressed with the food. My favorite is the Super Tostada, the fajitas and the guacamole. This will be a favorite place if you check it out!!

PjJf52Anm_0HV65kwr7CBQ.text: I'd like to write a review on the food, but I can't get by with the piss poor customer service. After sitting as a party of 6 for over an hour, the manager ignored us, our waiter was clueless, and we left. The manager chuckled it off as a lost table, but he lost many future tables and any recommendation. It wasn't busy enough to justify that sort of wait, and there's never an excuse to have a manager with that mistreatment of customers.

CwSY--AUuYjwaxUjWpSXdw.text: Every table was taken on a Tuesday night that speaks for it self! This place is truly authentic Mexican! The salsa is the True test and it passed! awesome lots of flavor and just the right amount of heat.  The tortillas are home made, any one that knows anything about Mexican food can tell a home made tortilla. The chimichanga had huge pieces of chicken not the typical shedded bla... hole in the wall local place that's worth going. Really really good food!'nn

5yhlE0qJStadgEKxL-Ikvg.text: Excellent food, will definitely be back my next time around to Arizona. I highly recommend this restaurant for drinks and great tasting authentic Mexican food, 5 stars all the way!!!!

Y7-ktBsBqOdykKVymyVm5g.text: By far the best Mexican food in Scottsdale! Food and Salsa amazing! Service phenomenal! Great prices!!!!

HRTw6ad2qX15qgWbDQpQLA.text: A great authentic and affordable, reasonably priced Mexican restaurant.

KuXCAI5PoiWx9V11a3GZnA.text: Great food & service. Bridget is the BEST waitress!  A group of us go here for lunch about once a month and she knew our orders by heart after our 2nd visit. Would highly recommend the topopo salad and the lunch buffet.

ctZo4KXur4m3HFdpEpihew.text: Met up with Rand H and Norm R for lunch here today.  We had been talking about going for Mexican food and Rand had been here before and liked it.  We got here right at 11am when they opened and all decided to do the buffet.  There weren't a lot of food choices - I had a cheese enchilada that was pretty good, a chile relleno that was just okay, some beef fajita meat that was fatty and tough, average rice and beans.  Nothing spectacular but not bad.  I think if I came here again I'd order off the regular menu and skip the buffet.

s4wYurlPlVEXoY3P_yrlVQ.text: If you look at the front, it doesn't look like a very appetizing place to eat, but my grandma dragged me in because she wanted Mexican food, and I guess I shouldn't judge books by their covers...to a certain point.  The inside was okay, just rows of booths. I have a thing about dirty places, so I think it should have been cleaner. I didn't dare go into the bathrooms.  We were two of about five people in there. Service was pretty good. I got the guacamole tostada lunch special with rice and beans. It was sooo good. My grandma got a chicken burrito which was good too. Their chips and salsa were BOMB.

s52Ox-qTn0Vm812S9Ex2dQ.text: I wanted to like this place...really, I did!  After reading reviews and looking at pictures, I had to try it.  The chips and salsa--very good!  The carne asada--not good.  At all.  It was very salty and kind of gross.  Instead of serving it like a steak (like I'm used to), it was cut up for me...I felt like I was 5 years old and not allowed to touch a knife.  I feel bad because our server was so nice!  I wish I could give 5 stars for the server alone, but unfortunately I went there for carne asada, not the waitress!

H-T-f2IAonAnfhJxfH_Uhg.text: Salsa=5 star. Very good cheap mexican food.  If you're into beef taco's like I am you will love this place.

TRguDuoIVfM4Hl-QvcFTAg.text: The food itself wasn't all that bad, however the staff was less than stellar. I actually ordered food to go there and the entire time I was waiting, I witnessed the staff having personal conversations that should have taken place outside of the work place. The staff wasn't rude, but they didn't seem to take many things seriously and I witnessed them not really paying much attention to many of their patrons.   So for the food, not bad at all. The service could use some help.

bn6UwjLff5sJ-nvPxweNVw.text: I love la fonda!  This is one of my fav mexican spots in town.  It's reasonably priced and the service is always pretty quick.  I highly recommend the taco salad with chicken, but I have ordered a little bit of everything on the menu and have never been disappointed.

gftIvJED8bB1uHzADqu65g.text: The best Salsa, great margarita's, very friendly staff, I've only been in 3x over a 2 month period and the waitress remember my name each time I come in.

4Vl_VbcpewKOyvjG1owNAA.text: La Fonda is located next to Oregano's on Shea.  It's a small little Mexican restaurant, but the food is really good.  The salsa is delish and the margaritas can always bring a smile to my face.  They're really strong, like a good margarita should be, and purchasing a pitcher of them mid-day when I should be working, makes them taste even better.  The waiters are friendly and fast, and I've never had a bad experience there.  It's a casual place, so you can come dressed however you want, and it's the perfect spot for a quick meal.  I've never had to wait for a table either- which is good for me, but probably not so great for the restaurant.   A couple of times, I've come here instead of going to Oregano's when they have their two hour wait going on, and I'm always glad I did.  Give it a try next time you're in the area!

v4jV2Jv2OVkzmgZ1WCZD7g.text: Well I've promised to put a few reviews on here to get past my joining Yelp just to vent my frustrations with one (now defunct) business.  So, I can think of no better restaurant to start with than La Fonda.  I've been coming here since I was kid; it was my father's favorite Mexican joint, and it is now mine and my son's as well!  My son and I have dinner alone together once a week and have made La Fonda our restaurant of choice!  The chips can be a bit greasy (hence not 5 stars), but they're always hot and fresh, and the salsa's hands down the best in town.  None of that cooked, tastes like it came from a jar stuff; just fresh tomatoes, onions, cilantro, etc.-- it's so good, I could inhale it.  Being the creatures of habit we are, Jacob and I always get the same things every week. (Nowadays, we just order "the usual.")  For Jacob, it's a cheese crisp with guacamole, for me, it's a machaca burro and a side of beans.  I've had other things in the past...  the tamales are wonderful too, but I absolutely LOVE the machaca.  It's tender, crispy and fried up with lots of onions and peppers.  It's delicious!!  The beans are good too, but beans are beans; it's the machaca I keep coming back for.   As for the atmosphere, it can definitely get a bit loud in there when it's busy.  The sound just seems to reverberate off the tile and concrete.  And...  pray that no one near you orders fajitas, or you will (guaranteed!) smell like them for the rest of the evening.   But, again, I am addicted to the machaca and therefore find the rest to be mere trifles.  What more can I say-- I love La Fonda.

j4V8v-4Kh6tanSaP_DR-sg.text: It's kinda nice having this Mexican joint in Sdale. Very good Sonoran Mexican and nice staff. I say joint because it looks like its been around for awhile; not a prettified corporate place.

YUsaBh4DNgbG6C_ODsojow.text: Another great Mexican spot in Arizona.  Does it ever get bad here??  Love this place, read many great reviews and finally stopped by and had a wonderful, flavorful meal.

B0XRnjHpzlWyjaCMgxZ2jw.text: This is the place my friends and I go for Mexican food. Very tasty, affordable, and fairly quick service.

BO4DDB87BC367_zD51LAxA.text: So I am very picky about my Mexican food & to be honest the ONLY reason we came to this place is because Oregano's was on their usual 50 hr wait. I was pretty scared when we walked up to it, and was just as scared when we were seated.  Before we got a chance to situate ourselves water & chips & salsa were in front of us.  The chips & salsa were good, not amazing but it was good & i had my fair share of them. I was VERY impressed with our servers speed & attention.  The entree prices are kinda pricey...meaning $11-$13 a plate but we ordered them anyway.  To my surprise the food was GREAT! I don't remember the name of the plate I ordered but it had an enchilada, a taco, & a tamale.  EVERYTHING was good! I mean, not blow your mind you'll never have anything better than this again, but it was very tasty.  If we ever have to long of a wait at Oregano's again, we will return.  However we live in Phoenix so the chances of us being in Scottsdale again just for Mexican food are slim.  But I would recommend it to anyone who wants good food & speedy service.

wyRgFwxwGa6yI635QY18nA.text: Just good mexican food, salsa is excellent!

6EM5NprHFJimxv3ZF2exJQ.text: To set the record straight, the service here was great.  The food...not so much.  Started off with some chips and salsa...pretty standard.  Had two different types of salsas...one hot and one mild.  Had two carnitas tacos, which came with rices and beans.  The rice and beans were good...beans were pretty rich.  The carnitas were pretty dry, but the worst part was the tacos were topped with this even more dry cabbage, onion, cilantro mixture.  I had to add a lot of salsa to make the tacos interesting.  I also tried the shrimp burro...aka a big shrimp burrito.  This actually wasnt that bad...pretty simple with some nice grilled shrimp and fajita-esque veggies.  The last thing I tried was the beef enchiladas.  The beef seemed to be machaca and it was tender.  The problem with the dish was that the enchilada sauce was extremely rich...it tasted like a mixture between velveeta cheese and hormel chili, which is one of my favorite tailgating foods...not my favorite enchilada topping.    With the number of mexican restaurants in scottsdale and phoenix...there is no need for me to come back here.

RL6P9vLGrnID7UZeShvJlA.text: Growing up in the Southwest I can honestly say that I am to Mexican food what Casey Anthony is to scandalous whoring.  With that being said, La Fonda Del Sol can most aptly be described as better than average... more than adequate....above par...and a step above decent. The chips and salsa were very good but the pollo fundito had way too much cream cheese. The side of refried beans and rice was perfect. At many Mexican restaurants, beans and rice are a throwaway. An afterthought. Not here. These sides truly stole the show. One aspect of my visit that was very disappointing was the fact that they don't serve Tecate in a can.  The can is necessary for one to smear bit's of lime, lime juice and salt around the surface of said can to truly appreciate the wonders of a perfect beer on a hot summer evening, with the beading, condensation dripping down the side of the freezing cold can and chunks of acidic lime flesh washing down the smooth, light hoppiness that is indicative of a good Mexican cerveza.

Na6ja_PWMna_fMza4yVMcw.text: I've eaten here 5 or 6 times over the last two years and the food is always great.  Service has always been good as well and I have never felt rushed to leave after the meal.  Decent prices as well.  We would definitely eat here more often if we lived closer.
